<p>Nuclear Engineer (Mechanical) Degree Apprentice<\u002Fp>\n <p> The NUVIA Apprentice Programmes offer the perfect opportunity to gain ‘on the job’ training and experience with industry experts, whilst studying for a degree - without the worry of covering tuition fees!<\u002Fp>\n <p> At NUVIA UK, we’re looking for ambitious individuals to undertake our Nuclear Degree Apprenticeship, on the Mechanical Engineering pathway. This Apprenticeship Programme incorporates the Nuclear Engineer Standard, which teaches the common elements of engineering (including the application of Maths and Science to solve engineering problems, and understanding the principles of nuclear technology), whilst the ‘on the job’ aspect, provides the complimentary and practical experience of live projects, which help to shape your career and development.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Based at either our Harwell or Risley office, the first year of the Programme will see you working alongside our Consultancy Engineering team, with opportunities to work with our other nuclear specialist teams. Over the duration of the Programme, the opportunities will enable shadowing of experts which will embed the theoretical engineering knowledge for those with an inquisitive mind and desire to learn something new. We’d love openness to the idea of travel, whether that be in the UK or internationally - when these opportunities arise, they can provide invaluable experience and networks for the future.<\u002Fp>\n <p> On completion of the apprenticeship, you’ll be able to apply for professional registration as an Incorporated Engineer (IEng) through an appropriate Professional Engineering Institution.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Our Nuclear Degree Apprenticeship programme is aimed at people who have a passion for learning, the motivation to achieve and can rise to different challenges. If you possess the behaviours for success, we can give you the skills and knowledge to reach new heights.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> So, why choose NUVIA for your apprenticeship? As a subsidiary of, VINCI Construction, NUVIA Group are an international organisation that operate across many highly regulated sectors, including Nuclear. We have the opportunities, innovation, and support, that is synonymous with such a global giant. Using our joint expertise, we collaborate with diverse clients and nuclear sites and get involved with multiple projects across the UK and overseas.<\u002Fp>\n <p> We are a performance-driven organisation, committed to the development of our people within a culture of safety, innovation, and excellence.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The things that you’d need to consider when applying for this apprenticeship include the requirement for<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>5 GCSE’s (A*-C’s or 5-9) including Maths, English and Science<\u002Fli>\n  <li>3 A level’s (A*-C) including Maths and Science related subjects or relevant Level 3 \u002F 4 qualification \u002F HNC<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Although your academic ability is important to us (as we want to ensure that you’re able to handle the theoretical requirements of the degree), it is equally vital that your enthusiasm and proactive organisation skills shine through, as you’ll be encouraged to share your passions with future generations, by becoming a STEM Ambassador and an active member of the Young Generation Network (YGN). Have the courage to get ‘stuck in’ – we’ll be behind you all the way!<\u002Fp>\n <p> In summary, here’s what you need to know….<\u002Fp>\n <p> Role: Nuclear Engineer (Mechanical) Degree Apprentice<br> Apprenticeship Standard: Nuclear Scientist &amp; Nuclear Engineer (Integrated Degree)<br> Duration: 4 to 5 years (including End Point Assessment)<br> Provider: Dependant on location<br> Location: Risley, Warrington, Cheshire or Harwell, Oxfordshire<br> Academic Requirements:<br> 5 GCSE’s (A* - C \u002F 5 – 9) inc. Maths English &amp; Science and 3 Level 3 qualifications in Maths\u002FScience\u002Frelevant subject<br> Other Requirements:<br> Ability to demonstrate enthusiasm, self-motivation, be proactive and take responsibility<\u002Fp>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> Subsidiary of VINCI Construction, and division of the world-leading VINCI Group, NUVIA is an international company that operates world-wide on highly regulated and sensitive industrial sites, and has done for decades. We have been involved in<br> all the major nuclear projects in the world thanks to our solid and historical expertise.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Today, NUVIA is a key-partner for highly demanding industries that place regulatory requirements and safety at the top of their priorities. Our clients can also count on NUVIA for cutting-edge support services and solutions. With three ranges of NUVIATech products, NUVIA is a leading designer and supplier of sophisticated radiation protection and detection instruments, as valuable in Healthcare, protection, as in radioactivity geolocation..<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>NUVIA est une branche de VINCI, plus grand groupe intégré de concessions et BTP du monde. NUVIA est plus particulièrement l'entité nucléaire du Groupe VINCI et est impliqué dans le cycle de vie tout entier des installations nucléaires, du New Build au démantèlement, en passant par la maintenance et l'exploitation. NUVIA est en croissance constante, avec plus de 2700 salariés dans le monde. En moyenne, 100 hommes et femmes nous rejoignent chaque année. Maintenant, plus que jamais, nous recherchons de nouveaux talents pour soutenir la croissance du groupe.<\u002Fp>\n <p>Whether it’s stabilising bridges, tunnelling under the Thames or delivering HS2, our people bring together experience, innovation and expertise to deliver high-quality ground engineering solutions. A career at Bachy Soletanche gives you the opportunity to push boundaries, explore new ideas and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Bachy Soletanche are seeking at Section Engineer to join the Greenwich Pumping Station (GREPS) shaft civil team, responsible for delivering the remaining civil works of deep shaft.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Background Information<\u002Fp>\n <p> The Costain, Vinci, Bachy joint venture (CVB) that is in charge of this contract, will be delivering the East Section of a new tunnel to protect the tidal River Thames from the tens of millions of tonnes of sewage pollution discharged into it every year, via overflow points built into the capital’s overstretched, largely Victorian sewerage network.<\u002Fp>\n <p> CVB are delivering the £605m Tideway East project, which consists of a tunnel from Chambers Wharf to Abbey Mills Pumping Station, a smaller connection tunnel from Greenwich Pumping Station to Chambers Wharf, as well as the shafts and CSO structures required to connect into London’s existing sewer network.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Key Tasks include but not limited to:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li><p> Slip forming of the shaft secondary lining o Thickness of 650mm, Shaft depth 47m, Diameter of 17m, Estimated concrete volume 2836m3.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> The Greenwich Tunnel Connection portal eye, of 7m diameter.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Vortex tube, a stainless-steel pipe 37m height and 3.2m diameter.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Mass fill concrete of the bottom of the shaft.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Three (3) shaft Internal walls, 1m thick and up to 25m high.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Suspended internal works, such as viewing platforms and access platforms.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Benching of the shaft.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Culvert connection between shaft and the culvert.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> All temporary works needed for main works installation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> All shaft civil works (with exception of the cover slab) will be carried out under an acoustic shed, allowing for night shifts works.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Dismantling of a steel acoustic shed, 20m wide, 60m long and 15m high.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Prefabricated cover slab made of o precast beams, up to 16m long and 71 tons, more than 20 precast covers.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <li><p> Several upstand and cast in situ civil works<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> When you join the world’s largest specialist geotechnical contractor, you’re part of an international community of over 10,000 experts, based in 31 countries around the world. You’ll have the opportunity to contribute to prestigious, ground-breaking projects, using the very latest tools and technology to solve complex problems, constantly learn new skills and take your career in any direction.<\u002Fp>\n <p> We value our team and colleagues as the most important assets we have and we know that it is working together to overcome the most complex geotechnical challenges that ultimately allows us to fuel that feeling of pride.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Our Mission: Proud to create sustainable geotechnical solutions through Trust, Partnership and Excellence.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Our Values: In line with our Mission Statement, the main Values that shape our behaviours, unify us a team and help us build long lasting relationships with our clients are: TEC-TAC = Teamwork, Excellence, Creative, Trust, Accountability, Caring.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Bachy Soletanche is a worldwide, leading specialist in modern geotechnics and foundation engineering. We bring our experience, innovation, and expertise together to deliver the highest quality ground engineering solutions. Whether you are seeking a small-scale sub-contractor or a major joint venture partner, we operate at every level and can offer as much support as you need to deliver your programme. We believe that successful outcomes are based on collaboration, mutual respect and well-resourced teamwork. Our designs and advice are based on reliable evidence and relevant experience. Our designers, engineers, project managers and workforce all work together to protect your best interests. Depending on the scale of your project, you will receive the specialist guidance of either our Core Business or Major Projects team to ensure we offer the most tailored approach to your scheme. We listen, we question, we challenge, and we deliver.<\u002Fp>\n <p>Kigtek delivers process control, monitoring and safety solutions to a number of the world’s leading spirits manufacturers helping them to produce many of the world’s best known spirits brands. Our work takes us to some of the largest, most advanced and highest volume drinks production sites in the UK.<\u002Fp>\n <p> We have a vacancy for a suitably experienced Office Administrator to be based at our Bellshill Office.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Competitive Salary + Pension + Benefits<\u002Fp>\n <p> About the role<\u002Fp>\n <p> Duties will include (but not limited to as the role would be expected to develop and grow in line with the business).<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Managing the reception area, including welcoming customers, vendors and visitors.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Managing company correspondence, including phone calls, letters and packages.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Creating travel itineraries for business managers, project managers, employees and company events.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Fleet records management (scheduling MOT\u002FVehicle maintenance and TAX) as well as recoding vehicle mileage.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Organising meeting refreshments when required teas, coffees, lunches etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Completion of routine compliance tasks (eg scheduling fire alarm tests, scheduling calibration tests, etc)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Some Facilities Management (recording of fuel consumption, fuel card management and credit card spend recording.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Book keeping entries when required.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> The Candidate<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> You will be a dynamic and proactive team player, who strives to deliver a high level of customer service to business stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will be polite, confident and well presented, as you will often be the first contact for customers, vendors and visitors to our business.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will have strong interpersonal, written and communication skills as well as a thirst for knowledge, and a commitment to accuracy.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ideally you will be qualified to Higher Grade English\u002FMaths or above as a minimum, with candidates with qualification or experience in accounts or book-keeping at an advantage, as some ERP system input may be required during busy periods and holidays.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A good working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel and Outlook) is essential.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You must be eligible to work in the UK and have a full UK driving licence.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Kigtek<\u002Fp>\n <p> Kigtek is part of the VINCI Energies UK and ROI operating within their Actemium Automation perimeter. Actemium have been providing high quality engineering solutions and services in the UK since 1907. Our de-centralised business model allows us to provide our customers with the resources, vitality and strength of a large global company, while still delivering local personalised service. Along with the other business units in the Actemium Automation family, we employ over 250 people at 14 locations across the UK.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Vinci are a world leader in engineering and construction with 220,000 employees operating out of 3,000 offices in 120 countries across the globe.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Part of the VINCI Energies Group, Actemium provide engineering design, project management, installation and commissioning of electrical, mechanical and IT services in the United Kingdom since 1907. <p>We are currently recruiting for an experienced Mechanical Engineer to support the AXIOM framework. Preferred location will be Sellafield but candidates looking to be based out of Birchwood Park in Warrington will also be considered.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Project Description:<\u002Fp>\n <p> The Plant Facing Design Office (PFDO) deals with urgent plant related issues, supports System Engineering with design support and handles emergent maintenance delivery issues with design content.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Role Description:<\u002Fp>\n <p> PFDO have a requirement for a Mechanical Design Engineer to provide a design service to OUs within the Remediation and Waste Management (R&amp;WM) directorate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> This role will involve developing mechanical design solutions in response to problem definitions from the OU system engineering community dealing with plant failures and potential improvements.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The problems that are likely to occur will be varied for plant, pipework and equipment on several Sellafield plants dealing with High Active, Medium Active and Low Active waste streams that process, compact, encapsulate, vitrify or package waste. The equipment or machinery could be used within a shielded cell being bespoke and designed for remote handling or remote operation in hazardous areas, or out cell where the equipment is more likely to be of a conventional nature for mechanical handling material in man accessible areas. The pipework could be located within buildings or externally providing services to and from buildings.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Essential Experience &amp; Qualifications:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Degree in relevant engineering discipline with at least 2 years design delivery experience OR other qualification such as BTEC, HNC, HND, with 5-8 years design delivery experience.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to demonstrate equivalent SQEP against SL Designer role SR0754.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A sound engineering background with knowledge of general mechanical design aspects such as material selection, tolerancing, geometric tolerancing, surface finishes, and welding.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Familiarity and experience of designing equipment for in cell applications involving remote maintenance and operation.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Familiarity with crane and lifting equipment design, as such knowledge and past experience using crane and other design specifications and guides e.g. BS2573, The Machinery Regulations, LOLER, and PUWER are required.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Previous experience involving the design of mechanical \u002F electrical machinery.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Previous experience producing piping isometric drawings and pipe supports etc. suitable for fabrication and installation using AutoCad.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Competent and proven piping design engineer familiar with ASME 31.3, PER, PSSR and CDM regulations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Competent and proven design engineer, capable of producing designs, schemes, drawings, and supporting calculations who is familiar with the roles and application of the CDM regulations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Previous experience producing design packages, suitable for manufacture and installation, containing drawings, method statements, risk assessments etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Previous experience producing designs for general fabrications.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Familiarity with Sellafield Ltd Piping design guides and piping specifications.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Familiarity and experience of working and complying with applicable SL Practices, standards, and engineering guides.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Familiarity with safety case principles and capable of providing design substantiation for equipment with designated nuclear safety functions to demonstrate that design solutions can meet the required safety function placed on it to the appropriate level.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Past experience with space management and equipment layout.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Past experience to have included elements of design, construction, commissioning and through life on plant technical support.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Familiarity or previous design experience with plants on the Sellafield site (Preferred).<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> Nuvia is a leading international engineering, project management and services provider to the highly regulated nuclear, defence, oil &amp; gas, and science &amp; research industries. Our expertise has been developed over many years and is backed up by a highly trained, committed workforce and a wide range of specialist resources.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>NUVIA est une branche de VINCI, plus grand groupe intégré de concessions et BTP du monde. NUVIA est plus particulièrement l'entité nucléaire du Groupe VINCI et est impliqué dans le cycle de vie tout entier des installations nucléaires, du New Build au démantèlement, en passant par la maintenance et l'exploitation. NUVIA est en croissance constante, avec plus de 2700 salariés dans le monde. En moyenne, 100 hommes et femmes nous rejoignent chaque année. Maintenant, plus que jamais, nous recherchons de nouveaux talents pour soutenir la croissance du groupe.<\u002Fp>\n Freyssinet forms part of the Soletanche Freyssinet Group, a name that is respected worldwide for delivering innovative solutions and pushing the envelope of civil and structural engineering achievement. Originally a specialist in bridge components and post-tensioning, Freyssinet has successfully expanded its portfolio of products and services into repair, protection and strengthening of structures: specialising in diagnostic surveys, repairs, refurbishment, bridge bearings, expansion joints and cathodic protection to reinforced concrete in the building, civil and marine sectors. Our employees are at the heart of everything Freyssinet does. Our motivated and dedicated workforce is a key driver of the exceptional service, skill and quality Freyssinet is renowned for, delivering complex and pioneering projects all around the UK. We believe in providing our employees with excellent benefits and place great importance on people development, helping our people to achieve their full potential and enjoy interesting and rewarding careers. pacification of activities and to follow all the Delivery To Site dates for equipment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Contribute to topics around good practises, innovation, improvement of processes, and <p>Kigtek delivers process control, monitoring and safety solutions to a number of the world’s leading spirits manufacturers helping them to produce many of the world’s best known spirits brands. Our work takes us to some of the largest, most advanced and highest volume drinks production sites in the UK. We are currently looking to recruit a Electrician (Hazardous areas)<\u002Fp>\n <p> We undertake work on sites throughout central Scotland from our bases in Leven, Fife and Bellshill, Lanarkshire.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Competitive Salary + Pension + Discretionary Bonus + Benefits<\u002Fp>\n <p> Fantastic opportunities to join our Electrical installation team.<\u002Fp>\n <p> About the role;<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Our operatives work primarily on industrial sites completing all aspects of electrical installations work and are expected to:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Work from electrical Single Line Diagrams and wiring schematics.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Install cabling containment systems such as cable tray and trunking.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Install a wide variety of cable types including power, communications and instrumentation, multi-core, braided and armoured.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Gland and terminate a wide variety of cable types included ATEX cables.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Perform IET and ATEX cable testing and complete corresponding test sheets.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> The Candidate;<\u002Fp>\n <p> You will be a dynamic and proactive team player who strives to deliver high-quality work and the highest level of customer service.<\u002Fp>\n <p> You will be prepared to travel to different client sites and adhere their and Kigtek’s health and safety working practices.<\u002Fp>\n <p> You will have a valid ECS card and Compex 01-04 certificate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> You must be eligible to work in the UK and have a full UK driving licence.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Kigtek is part of the VINCI Energies UK and ROI operating within their Actemium Automation perimeter. Actemium have been providing high quality engineering solutions and services in the UK since 1907. Our de-centralised business model allows us to provide our customers with the resources, vitality and strength of a large global company, while still delivering local personalised service. <p>Project Description:<\u002Fp>\n <p> A new cooling system is required to support long term safe storage of spent fuel within a storage pond. The system will need to provide a flexible cooling capability to maintain the pond temperature and manage changes in heat loadings within the pond dependent upon operational throughput. The cooling system will need to be robust to ensure that it is able to continue to provide cooling in for a range of different fault scenarios, which will be assessed by the project safety assessment team.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The project is currently in its Appraise and Select phase, with the current work scope being delivered to reduce key project and technical risks such that the project will be able to pass through its Outline Business Case gate and into detailed design, which will develop and detail the system design to enable it to be fabricated and constructed.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Role Description:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Process engineering resource required to deliver work scope in support of the lead process engineer for the new THORP Receipt &amp; Storage Cooling System:-<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Undertake process design delivery, collaborating with the project Engineering Manager and other discipline leads to meet project milestones.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support the building, monitoring and reporting of progress against a delivery schedule.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be able to proactively engage with the integrated project team and wider project stakeholders (plant personnel, system engineers, construction team etc)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assist in the derivation of project requirements and verification activities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Undertake site visits &amp; inspections where required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Deputise for the lead process engineer when required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Production and checking of process deliverables including<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Development of Basis of Process Safety and Hazard Management Strategies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Process information gathering and interrogation of this information<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support to development of project estimates and schedule<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Appraisal of options and support to option down selection decisions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Underpinning Process Design Calculations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> P&amp;IDS<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Technical Reports<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Technical Specifications<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Safety Case Substantiation<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Essential Experience &amp; Qualifications:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Chartered Process Engineer<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrate strong leadership behaviours to drive timely delivery of an engineering schedule to quality and cost.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experienced in delivering work for SL (preferred).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A strong understanding of the challenges faced working on a project that has key interfaces with the nuclear safety case (preferred)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Proficient user of MS Office suite<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience using Cimage, Pipenet and Icepac (preferred)<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> Nuvia is a leading international engineering, project management and services provider to the highly regulated nuclear, defence, oil &amp; gas, and science &amp; research industries. Our expertise has been developed over many years and is backed up by a highly trained, committed workforce and a wide range of specialist resources.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>NUVIA est une branche de VINCI, plus grand groupe intégré de concessions et BTP du monde. NUVIA est plus particulièrement l'entité nucléaire du Groupe VINCI et est impliqué dans le cycle de vie tout entier des installations nucléaires, du New Build au démantèlement, en passant par la maintenance et l'exploitation. NUVIA est en croissance constante, avec plus de 2700 salariés dans le monde. En moyenne, 100 hommes et femmes nous rejoignent chaque année. Maintenant, plus que jamais, nous recherchons de nouveaux talents pour soutenir la croissance du groupe.<\u002Fp>\n <p>Nuclear Engineer (Mechanical) Degree Apprentice<\u002Fp>\n <p> The NUVIA Apprentice Programmes offer the perfect opportunity to gain ‘on the job’ training and experience with industry experts, whilst studying for a degree - without the worry of covering tuition fees!<\u002Fp>\n <p> At NUVIA UK, we’re looking for ambitious individuals to undertake our Nuclear Degree Apprenticeship, on the Mechanical Engineering pathway. This Apprenticeship Programme incorporates the Nuclear Engineer Standard, which teaches the common elements of engineering (including the application of Maths and Science to solve engineering problems, and understanding the principles of nuclear technology), whilst the ‘on the job’ aspect, provides the complimentary and practical experience of live projects, which help to shape your career and development.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Based at either our Harwell or Risley office, the first year of the Programme will see you working alongside our Consultancy Engineering team, with opportunities to work with our other nuclear specialist teams. Over the duration of the Programme, the opportunities will enable shadowing of experts which will embed the theoretical engineering knowledge for those with an inquisitive mind and desire to learn something new. We’d love openness to the idea of travel, whether that be in the UK or internationally - when these opportunities arise, they can provide invaluable experience and networks for the future.<\u002Fp>\n <p> On completion of the apprenticeship, you’ll be able to apply for professional registration as an Incorporated Engineer (IEng) through an appropriate Professional Engineering Institution.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Our Nuclear Degree Apprenticeship programme is aimed at people who have a passion for learning, the motivation to achieve and can rise to different challenges. If you possess the behaviours for success, we can give you the skills and knowledge to reach new heights.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> So, why choose NUVIA for your apprenticeship? As a subsidiary of, VINCI Construction, NUVIA Group are an international organisation that operate across many highly regulated sectors, including Nuclear. We have the opportunities, innovation, and support, that is synonymous with such a global giant. Using our joint expertise, we collaborate with diverse clients and nuclear sites and get involved with multiple projects across the UK and overseas.<\u002Fp>\n <p> We are a performance-driven organisation, committed to the development of our people within a culture of safety, innovation, and excellence.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The things that you’d need to consider when applying for this apprenticeship include the requirement for<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>5 GCSE’s (A*-C’s or 5-9) including Maths, English and Science<\u002Fli>\n  <li>3 A level’s (A*-C) including Maths and Science related subjects or relevant Level 3 \u002F 4 qualification \u002F HNC<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Although your academic ability is important to us (as we want to ensure that you’re able to handle the theoretical requirements of the degree), it is equally vital that your enthusiasm and proactive organisation skills shine through, as you’ll be encouraged to share your passions with future generations, by becoming a STEM Ambassador and an active member of the Young Generation Network (YGN). Have the courage to get ‘stuck in’ – we’ll be behind you all the way!<\u002Fp>\n <p> In summary, here’s what you need to know….<\u002Fp>\n <p> Role: Nuclear Engineer (Mechanical) Degree Apprentice<br> Apprenticeship Standard: Nuclear Scientist &amp; Nuclear Engineer (Integrated Degree)<br> Duration: 4 to 5 years (including End Point Assessment)<br> Provider: Dependant on location<br> Location: Risley, Warrington, Cheshire or Harwell, Oxfordshire<br> Academic Requirements:<br> 5 GCSE’s (A* - C \u002F 5 – 9) inc. Maths English &amp; Science and 3 Level 3 qualifications in Maths\u002FScience\u002Frelevant subject<br> Other Requirements: Ability to demonstrate enthusiasm, self-motivation, be proactive and take responsibility<\u002Fp>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> Subsidiary of VINCI Construction, and division of the world-leading VINCI Group, NUVIA is an international company that operates world-wide on highly regulated and sensitive industrial sites, and has done for decades. We have been involved in<br> all the major nuclear projects in the world thanks to our solid and historical expertise.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Today, NUVIA is a key-partner for highly demanding industries that place regulatory requirements and safety at the top of their priorities. Our clients can also count on NUVIA for cutting-edge support services and solutions. With three ranges of NUVIATech products, NUVIA is a leading designer and supplier of sophisticated radiation protection and detection instruments, as valuable in Healthcare, protection, as in radioactivity geolocation..<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>NUVIA est une branche de VINCI, plus grand groupe intégré de concessions et BTP du monde. NUVIA est plus particulièrement l'entité nucléaire du Groupe VINCI et est impliqué dans le cycle de vie tout entier des installations nucléaires, du New Build au démantèlement, en passant par la maintenance et l'exploitation. NUVIA est en croissance constante, avec plus de 2700 salariés dans le monde. En moyenne, 100 hommes et femmes nous rejoignent chaque année. <p>Overview<\u002Fp>\n <p> Nuvia has several exciting opportunities to launch your international career, with a role split between the UK and Belgium. One of our European clients requires consulting expertise regarding their decommissioning stream of work.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Nuvia is therefore looking to recruit SQEP personnel, as per the description below, for these roles that will certainly be of interest to those looking to dip their toe into international working experience!<\u002Fp>\n <p> Description of the assignment<\u002Fp>\n <p> Be responsible for conducting Engineering Studies which will serve as input for the Final Decommissioning Plan (FDP) of the Belgian Units. These studies are mainly conceptual design studies for the dismantling of the main components of the Nuclear Power Plant. The mission is under guidance of the Lead Engineer and will work closely together with team and Project Manager. You will be required to work in Brussels 2 days per week or 2 nights every two weeks, subject to agreement from the client. Travel expense will be paid for.<\u002Fp>\n <p> As Design Engineer, you will have experience developing conceptual design studies and in-depth expertise in one or more of these fields:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Decommissioning of nuclear installations, including the set-up of preliminary and final decommissioning plans.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Radioactive waste treatment and conditioning techniques.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Radioactive waste interim storage buildings.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Treatment and conditioning systems of solid waste and liquid &amp; gaseous effluents.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Nuclear Power Plant primary systems and\u002For equipment.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Experience &amp; Qualifications:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Master's degree in Engineering with a strong will to develop technical expertise.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in the Nuclear industry is preference and particularly radioactive waste management and decommissioning.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> At least 5 years’ experience in the aforementioned areas of expertise is expected.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> In your day-to-day, you will be expected to converse with various nationalities. As such, fluency in English is a minimum requirement, with an added preference given to those with French and\u002For Dutch language skills also.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to draw up reports in English, and where possible, in Dutch also.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Familiar with MS Office software suite, Visual Basic &amp; Access.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> Nuvia is a leading international engineering, project management and services provider to the highly regulated nuclear, defence, oil &amp; gas, and science &amp; research industries, both in the UK and overseas. Our expertise has been developed over many years and is backed up by a highly trained, committed workforce and a wide range of specialist resources.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>NUVIA est une branche de VINCI, plus grand groupe intégré de concessions et BTP du monde. NUVIA est plus particulièrement l'entité nucléaire du Groupe VINCI et est impliqué dans le cycle de vie tout entier des installations nucléaires, du New Build au démantèlement, en passant par la maintenance et l'exploitation. NUVIA est en croissance constante, avec plus de 2700 salariés dans le monde. En moyenne, 100 hommes et femmes nous rejoignent chaque année. Maintenant, plus que jamais, nous recherchons de nouveaux talents pour soutenir la croissance du groupe.<\u002Fp>\n <p>The scope of the project is to develop the User and Functional requirements level suite of documentation to allow a control system integrator to develop the requirements into an operational replacement system compliant with client requirements, engineering standards and guides. The Control System Engineer will be based in either Warrington or Cumbria with some remote working. Required to support ongoing projects to replace legacy control systems.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Key Responsibilities:<\u002Fp>\n <p> The successful candidate will be required to produce \u002F support in the production of the following documents:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> CE&amp;I Basis of Design<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Control Philosophy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> User Requirement Specifications<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Functional Requirement Specifications<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Sequence Interlock Diagrams<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Graphic Requirements and User Interface Requirement Specifications<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Panel Design Requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Installation Design Requirements<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Will work closely within the Integrated project teams including team engineers, stakeholders and project management and controls.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Attending site visits to undertake site surveys.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Attending client and supplier meetings.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Essential Experience &amp; Qualifications:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> It is not necessary for candidates to have nuclear experience.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The candidates must have significant demonstrable experience in working in control system requirements capture.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ideally the candidate will have experience in understanding PROVOX DCS configurations using ENVOX.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Can demonstrate ability of undertaking site visits to ascertain validation of client requirements and confirmation of existing installed equipment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Have the ability to work as part of an Integrated delivery team, and individually, working within sometimes restrictive time constraints.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Have strong interpersonal skills and be able to interact with people at all levels.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be Degree Qualified in appropriate discipline or demonstrable experience.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge of CONCISE functional requirements capture tool and repository would be an advantage.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> Nuvia is a leading international engineering, project management and services provider to the highly regulated nuclear, defence, oil &amp; gas, and science &amp; research industries. Our expertise has been developed over many years and is backed up by a highly trained, committed workforce and a wide range of specialist resources.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>NUVIA est une branche de VINCI, plus grand groupe intégré de concessions et BTP du monde. NUVIA est plus particulièrement l'entité nucléaire du Groupe VINCI et est impliqué dans le cycle de vie tout entier des installations nucléaires, du New Build au démantèlement, en passant par la maintenance et l'exploitation. NUVIA est en croissance constante, avec plus de 2700 salariés dans le monde. En moyenne, 100 hommes et femmes nous rejoignent chaque année. Maintenant, plus que jamais, nous recherchons de nouveaux talents pour soutenir la croissance du groupe.<\u002Fp>\n <p>Kigtek Solutions Ltd are a leading Scottish Systems Integrator and Electrical Installation Company based in the central belt of Scotland. The company was founded in 2009 and joined the Vinci Energies UK &amp; ROI Family in March 2022.<\u002Fp>\n <p> We delivers process control, monitoring and safety solutions to a number of the world’s leading spirits manufacturers helping them to produce many of the world’s best known spirits brands. Our work takes us to some of the largest, most advanced and highest volume drinks production sites in the UK.<\u002Fp>\n <p> We are currently looking to recruit a Project Manager<\u002Fp>\n <p> Competitive Salary + Pension + Discretionary Bonus + Benefits<\u002Fp>\n <p> Incredible career opportunities have become available for experienced Project Managers to join our team operating from our Bellshill office near Glasgow.<br> <br> Each of our Project Managers operates with a diverse portfolio of live projects and have full responsibility for leading these projects to successful outcomes and meeting or exceeding our customers’ expectations. Key to this is developing strong team relationships within Kigtek, with our customers and our supply chain.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Our Project Managers have full commercial and contractual responsibility and work closely with their technical teams to develop, maintain and execute the overall delivery strategies and project plans. Project Managers deliver our projects in the most efficient and cost-effective manner whilst complying with our Management Systems for Quality (ISO 9001) and Functional Safety (BS EN 61511\u002F61508)<\u002Fp>\n <p> Main responsibilities:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> For each project have a clear understanding of the project scope, roles and responsibilities and manage accordingly<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Develop and maintain project plans including project quality plans, development plans and Gantt charts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure plans are communicated, understood and agreed internally, with our customers and relevant suppliers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure all our work activities are performed in a controlled and safe manner in accordance with the relevant UK, Kigtek and Customers Health and Safety requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Monitor project costs and update corresponding monthly project reviews<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure project adherence to our Management Systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Lead teams of engineers, and when needed, contractors, sub-contractors, and work partners, to ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget and to quality requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Identify, manage, and mitigate project risks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Develop excellent customer relationships leading to ongoing works<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> You will be a dynamic and proactive team player who strives to deliver high-quality work and the highest level of customer service.<\u002Fp>\n <p> You will have strong interpersonal, written and communication skills as well as a thirst for knowledge and commitment to successful project deliveries within a dynamic and challenging environment.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Ideally you will be Degree qualified (or equivalent) in an Engineering related subject and have completed modules or a post-graduate qualification in Project Management. You will have experience of leading multi-disciplinary teams delivering critical PLC\u002FSCADA based projects to high volume fast paced manufacturing sites.<\u002Fp>\n <p> An understanding of PLC and SCADA technologies and the underpinning infrastructures is essential<\u002Fp>\n <p> You must be able work autonomously, be able to think out the box and lead your teams through the typical challenges of project delivery.<\u002Fp>\n <p> A good working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel and Outlook) and Microsoft Project is essential.<\u002Fp>\n <p> You must be eligible to work in the UK and have a full UK driving licence.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Part of the VINCI Energies Group, Actemium provide engineering design, project management, installation and commissioning of electrical, mechanical and IT services in the United Kingdom since 1907. In addition, we provide specialist maintenance operations, fully complemented with accredited safety tests and inspection services to optimise the operational efficiency and safety of our client's equipment and systems. Whilst part of a global network of 300 Business Units, Actemium UK comprises of 7 Business Units covering all of the UK &amp; RoI.<\u002Fp>\n <p>Eltek Systems is a leading provider of industrial process and automation solutions to the food industry and is part of VINCI Energies with 12 offices across the country and over 250 engineers. We are looking to recruit an experienced Electrical Design engineer.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Competitive Salary + Pension + Share Scheme + Healthcare + Electric Vehicle Car Scheme + 25 days holiday + Benefits<\u002Fp>\n <p> The Role<\u002Fp>\n <p> The electrical design engineer role will be to interpret customer requirements and translate into the necessary electrical components required to match the application. Produce comprehensive electrical designs which achieve the process control requirements of clients in the food manufacturing industry.<\u002Fp>\n <p> You will be responsible for compiling parts lists associated to the electrical design, generating quotations and liaising with software engineers to ensure the integration of appropriate programming to achieve the desired control processes.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Once designs are complete and an order has been received you will be responsible for overseeing the assembly of the MCC's and Control Panels, this will include liaising with our purchasing department to ensure all necessary parts are available to meet the build slot. <p>Overview<\u002Fp>\n <p> Nuvia has several exciting opportunities to launch your international career, with a role split between the UK and Belgium. In close collaboration with colleagues and Team Lead, contribute to Engineering Studies and projects in the field of Radiological Characterisation. You will be required to work in Brussels 2 days per week or 2 nights every two weeks, subject to agreement from the client. Travel expense will be paid for.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Responsibilities:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Developing and applying string capabilities with in-house developed nuclear simulation tools for the characterisation of operational and dismantling waste.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Contributing to the development of waste characterisation methodologies and to the preparation of nuclear installation characterisation campaigns.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Verifying work performed by colleagues.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Correctly applying the Integrated Management System (IMS) quality procedures.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Providing regular feedback concerning ongoing activities to your Team Lead &amp; gas, and science &amp; research industries, both in the UK and overseas. Our expertise has been developed over many years and is backed up by a highly trained, committed workforce and a wide range of specialist resources.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>NUVIA est une branche de VINCI, plus grand groupe intégré de concessions et BTP du monde. NUVIA est plus particulièrement l'entité nucléaire du Groupe VINCI et est impliqué dans le cycle de vie tout entier des installations nucléaires, du New Build au démantèlement, en passant par la maintenance et l'exploitation. NUVIA est en croissance constante, avec plus de 2700 salariés dans le monde. En moyenne, 100 hommes et femmes nous rejoignent chaque année. Omexom UK and ROI is a community of incredible people, empowered to deliver the promises of digital and energy revolutions. Our vision to create a better future sits at the heart of everything we do.<\u002Fp>\n <p> At Omexom you are free to be who you are and what you want to be. You can be part of a community that fosters entrepreneurial spirit and supports you in your personal development.<\u002Fp>\n <p> We offer a flexible working environment with strong benefits such as 25 days holidays, matched pension contributions, a generous company share scheme and healthcare cover. Our culture is reflected in our values which we embody by empowering and bringing together amazing people.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The Role<\u002Fp>\n <p> A Senior Design Engineer is required by the Omexom Transmission Business Unit to play a key part of our organisational success, ensuring commitments to our customers are delivered on time and to the highest standard.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The job holder will have a consistent track record of project delivery along with demonstrable experience in developing diverse teams.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Reporting to the Design Manager, duties will include, but are not limited to:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> To assist the Design Manager with appointing and provide training where necessary and manage design staff in an efficient manner.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Business development with DNOs and TSOs, including prospecting, tendering and delivering design services.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The management of all design elements within tender and construction phases of construction contracts.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Representing Omexom UK within the global Omexom engineering network\u002Fclubs<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Review and cascading of current industry standards.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Promote Safety, Health and Environmental awareness of all design staff.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure the quality of ALL design submissions.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Discharging the responsibilities of the Designer under the CDM regulations.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Essential Skills and Competencies<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Ability to take responsibility for all design elements of new build and refurbishment of overhead transmission lines in the UK<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to develop the Omexom overhead line design capability to provide services to the DNO<\u002Fli>\n  <li> and TSO markets<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Preferable BSc\u002FBEng in Structural or Civil Engineering with 15 Years OHL design and construction industry experience.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must have a detailed understanding of the latest OHL design practices, standards and analysis software systems.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must have suitable site experience \u002F understanding, which should include foundation setting out and construction, structure assembly and erection, conductor erection and temporary works.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Expert of energy technologies and IT services, VINCI Energies (64,500 employees, €10.2 billion of turnover) design, implement and maintain solutions to the industry, service sector and local communities. In the United Kingdom and Republic of Ireland, VINCI Energies provides electrical design, project management, installation and maintenance services since 1907. Through its 16 closely networked Business Units, VINCI Energies operates in 4 different sectors: Infrastructure, Industry, Telecommunications and building services.<\u002Fp>\n <p>Actemium Design (formerly North West Projects) is a national Engineering design company with a Nuclear sector focus. Being part of Vinci ENERGIES with a turnover of €13.7 billion, has allowed Actemium Design to grow in an exciting but secure manner. We are currently recruiting a Senior Mechanical Engineer. <p>Actemium ICP Business Unit is working on designing and delivering utility connections to the E-mobility and Industrial sectors, specifically electrical connections. We provide LV and 11kv Connection to the grid for our customers across UK, who are looking to recruit a Project Manager.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Competitive Salary + Bonus + Pension+ Benefits + Car Allowance<\u002Fp>\n <p> Job Responsibility:<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> To be part of the HV Project delivery team responsible for developing, estimating, planning and delivering connection projects in line with company values and objectives.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Job Duties:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Review client specifications<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assist the Design Engineer in developing the project at the Tendering stage<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support Tendering and Risk Review Process<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Site surveys and preliminary study coordination<\u002Fli>\n  <li> To effectively manage and deliver a portfolio of construction projects from design handover to construction completion\u002FEnergization, including all associated commissioning works.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Review the project on design handover and ensure the project is ready for <br> construction.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure project delivery programme is prepared and maintained for each project, ensuring a logical and efficient approach is established, meeting the required timescales.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Determine labour &amp; resource requirements and allocate projects to the supply chain<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Procurement coordination and delivery notes reconciliation with Project Coordinator<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Managing Project milestones<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Dynamic Risk Review<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure projects are delivered to exceed the client’s expectations, to agreed timescales and return the expected profitability.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Effective and professional communication with all project stakeholders: DNO\u002FIDNO, Clients, Councils, Supply Chain, and internal teams<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Familiarity with and implementation of the Project’s Contractual terms and Supply chain conditions.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure that the law is complied with at all times, including Electricity at Work, H&amp;S,ESQCR and CDM Regulations C<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Completion and\u002For Coordination of As-Laid drawings. Preparation of construction phase safety documentation on the projects, Risk Assessments, Method Statements and H&amp;S plans where necessary<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Preparation of Handover and Completion Packs<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Additional Duties:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Overall responsibility for the project<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Report the profit and loss of the project<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Responsibility for project profitability through Dynamic Procurement System<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinate project requirements at the design stage with civil, electrical, protection &amp; control designers with support from Project Designer<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support the Project Delivery Team during Project Change Process<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Skills and Qualifications:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Several years HV 11\u002F33kV Substation\u002FCable delivery to NERS requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> In-depth knowledge of ENA specification and G81s related to ICP works<\u002Fli>\n  <li> HNC minimum qualified in an Electrical Engineering discipline – preferred<\u002Fli>\n  <li> IEng Member of The IET - preferred<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Chartered Engineer or working towards Chartership - preferred<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Working knowledge of British Standards and G81’s<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Working knowledge of office software – MS word, excel, PowerPoint, project<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge of AutoCAD \u002F Amtech preferred<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Communication fields:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Internal: Leadership Team, Client Team, Procurement Department, Estimating Team and HSEQ department.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> External: Contractors, Suppliers, Service Providers, Clients, DNOs, IDNOs, and Members of the public<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Behavioural Competencies:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> The ideal candidate will be able to display good communication skills alongside a degree of flexibility and enthusiasm for the role and industry.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Part of the VINCI Energies Group, Actemium provide engineering design, project management, installation and commissioning of electrical, mechanical and IT services in the United Kingdom since 1907. In addition, we provide specialist maintenance operations, fully complemented with accredited safety tests and inspection services to optimise the operational efficiency and safety of our client's equipment and systems. Whilst part of a global network of 300 Business Units, Actemium UK comprises of 7 Business Units covering all of the UK &amp; RoI.<\u002Fp>\n <p>Actemium Automation Support is part of the VINCI Energies group. Being part of this £12.5 billion organisation allows us to provide our customers with the resources, vitality and strength of a large, global company, while still delivering local, personalised service. Along with the other business units in the Actemium Automation family, we employ 250+ people at 12 locations across the UK.<\u002Fp>\n <p> £ Competitive Salary + Company Vehicle + On-call allowance + Profit Share Scheme + 25 days holiday + Pension Contribution<\u002Fp>\n <p> The Role<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> You would be on our 24\u002F7 call rota, responding to emergency call out's.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The aim is to use your PLC and SCADA expertise to get your customer's plant back up-and-running as quickly as possible.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> As well as emergency call outs, you will also help your customers by carrying out planned support work to ensure their PLC and SCADA systems remain reliable and fit for purpose.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> The Person<\u002Fp>\n <p> Ideally you will need to be able to demonstrate experience in programming and trouble shooting on:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> PLC's (e.g. Siemens, Rockwell, Mitsubishi, Schneider)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> SCADA systems (e.g. Wonderware, GE Proficy, Rockwell).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> IT equipment and industrial communications networks.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> In addition, it would be highly advantageous if you may also be able to:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Understand low voltage electrical designs and drawings.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Trouble shoot electrical control panels and installations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Understand Instrumentation, PID Controls, Motor Control, VSDs, Servo<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Systems, sensors and actuators used in manufacturing or process environments.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Part of the VINCI Energies Group, Actemium provide engineering design, project management, installation and commissioning of electrical, mechanical and IT services in the United Kingdom since 1907. In addition, we provide specialist maintenance operations, fully complemented with accredited safety tests and inspection services to optimise the operational efficiency and safety of our client's equipment and systems. Whilst part of a global network of 300 Business Units, Actemium UK comprises of 7 Business Units covering all of the UK &amp; RoI.<\u002Fp>\n <p>Dounreay is Scotland's largest decommissioning project and is widely recognised as Europe's most complex nuclear closure programme. For more than 50 years it was known as the centre of the UK's fast reactor research and development and now the team is aiming to be recognised as a centre of excellence for nuclear decommissioning. Dounreay offers an opportunity to be involved in some of the UK's most leading edge technical projects, developing unique skills and experiences which are highly sought after across the industry.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Be part of it:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Vacancies have arisen within the Nuvia Health Physics team at Dounreay for Trainees Health Physics Surveyors to support our client’s ongoing decommissioning programme. The training programme will last for 2 years and will include an NVQ in Radiological Protection. Throughout the training your progress will be monitored and assessed against Nuvia and Client standards. You will compile an evidence folder, demonstrating your areas of learning with accredited certificates of completion for elements of your training.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Main responsibilities as an HP Surveyor:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Undertake radiation and contamination surveying both on the Dounreay Site and offsite in accordance with the defined routine monitoring program<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Undertake the changing of air sample and duct sample filter papers, and undertake counting of the filters to determine the activity present<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Support site operations as they progress by monitoring the radiological conditions and reporting the results<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Undertake surveying operations in areas with enhanced levels of radioactive contamination wearing appropriate PPE\u002FRPE<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Review and support the production of health physics documentation<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Assist with the familiarisation and training of Health Physics staff<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Be required to participate in emergency on-call arrangements<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Perform the responsibilities of Local\u002FManagement Appointments relevant to post<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Desirable skills, aptitudes and experience:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Minimum of 3 National 5’s at Grade C or equivalent, including English, Mathematics and one Science subject<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Open, flexible approach to work and prepared to undergo training<\u002Fli>\n  <li>The ability to communicate effectively with staff\u002Fcontractors at all levels<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ability to work on own initiative and as part of a team<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Required to be designated as a classified worker and as such must be 18 years old or over on the start date, in accordance with the Ionising Radiation Regulations 2017.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> Subsidiary of VINCI Construction, and division of the world-leading VINCI Group, NUVIA is an international company that operates world-wide on highly regulated and sensitive industrial sites, and has done for decades. We have been involved in<br> all the major nuclear projects in the world thanks to our solid and historical expertise.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Today, NUVIA is a key-partner for highly demanding industries that place regulatory requirements and safety at the top of their priorities. Our clients can also count on NUVIA for cutting-edge support services and solutions. With three ranges of NUVIATech products, NUVIA is a leading designer and supplier of sophisticated radiation protection and detection instruments, as valuable in Healthcare, protection, as in radioactivity geolocation<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>NUVIA est une branche de VINCI, plus grand groupe intégré de concessions et BTP du monde. NUVIA est plus particulièrement l'entité nucléaire du Groupe VINCI et est impliqué dans le cycle de vie tout entier des installations nucléaires, du New Build au démantèlement, en passant par la maintenance et l'exploitation. NUVIA est en croissance constante, avec plus de 2700 salariés dans le monde. En moyenne, 100 hommes et femmes nous rejoignent chaque année. Maintenant, plus que jamais, nous recherchons de nouveaux talents pour soutenir la croissance du groupe.<\u002Fp>\n We provide LV and 11kv Connection to the grid for our customers across UK, who are looking to recruit a Design Engineer. To be part of the HV Engineering design team in delivering commercially and technically <br> accurate designs in a timely manner<\u002Fp>\n <p> Competitive Salary + Car Allowance + Bonus + Pension+ Benefits<\u002Fp>\n <p> Design segments:<\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <ul>\n   <li><br> Electrical Substations and connections - mainly at 11kV and 33kV<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Contestable designs<\u002Fli>\n IDNO\u002F Private network electrical design<\u002Fli>\n  <li> bill of quantities of equipment in line with relevant IEC, DNO, IDNO, and client specifications<\u002Fli>\n  <li> cable calculations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> technical reports to accompany the design submissions detailing the specifics of the proposed connection arrangement<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Earthing layouts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Review client specifications<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Design HV substation layouts and elevations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> DNO and IDNO POC applications<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Protection settings<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Development and review of the single-line diagrams<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Liaise with external design houses and consultancies to produce accurate designs<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Interface with and attend meetings with clients, IDNO or DNO<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Review equipment manufacturers’ proposals and liaise with equipment manufacturers to ensure equipment suitability in line with the proposed design.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Approve and issue approved design for construction<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Input into the contract project plan, reporting progress as necessary and identifying any risks to the project progress and completion dates.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure that the law is complied with at all times, including Electricity at Work, H&amp;S,ESQCR and CDM Regulations.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Additional Duties:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Overall responsibility for the engineering design of the project<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Direct contact with the client representing Actemium Brand<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinate project requirements at the design stage with civil, electrical, protection &amp; control designers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordinate design with clients agents, sub-contractors, consultants and designers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Lead project from commencement until the handover to the Project Delivery Team<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support the Project Delivery Team during Project Design Change Process<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Configure and maintain the project program through the design phase of the project<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Preparation of design phase safety documentation on the projects, DNOs\u002FIDNOs<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Complete the project Environmental and Sustainability files<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Interface with and support the estimating process with Project Managers<\u002Fli>\n <li> 2 years HV Substation design to NERS requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Chartered Engineer or working towards Chartership preferred<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Working knowledge of British Standards and VINCI Energies Group, Actemium provide engineering design, project management, installation and commissioning of electrical, mechanical and IT services in the United Kingdom since 1907. <p>A vacancy has arisen for a Senior Mechanical Engineer within the team based in Warrington or Albion Square. This will be working on a contract basis, to provide technical support to the delivery of the Joint Venture framework, inclusive of multi-discipline design activities.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Main purpose of the role:<\u002Fp>\n <p> The candidate should be able to reference recent employment history where the Mech design Senior Engineer role has been successfully undertaken and shall be capable of the following as a minimum:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Produce or check the required design drawings and documentation for the appropriate base deliverables at all applicable stages of project design development.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> When varying task complexity and costs necessitate, be capable of leading a small team of designers through delivery of a package or at other times be capable and willing to originate a package individually.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Capable of performing plant configuration walk downs in order to confirm and accurately record task baseline details, propose outline schemes, produce basis of design documents and build estimates.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Capable of determining Engineering Requirements and provide underpinning for their Validation and Verification.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Capable of seeking, deploying and disseminating LFE as appropriate for the design tasks.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Capable of professionally representing the design team within the supply chain including technical evaluation of bids &amp; attendance at build customer acceptance tests as delegated by the Responsible Engineer.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Continuously producing a high standard of quality documentation, drawings, and project deliverables.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> At necessary lifecycle points and via appropriate project controls be capable of performing the design interfaces with other project disciplines, having an awareness of the basic project management fundamentals.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Providing a confident, clear and professional presentation of the tasks Mech design deliverables to all project stakeholders attending single and \u002F or multidiscipline design reviews.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Capable of producing and being accountable for their own effective time management, planning activities, task estimates and progress reporting.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Being competent and willing to guide and mentor graduates, apprentices and other less experienced Mech design team members.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Understanding self-limitations and the value \u002F importance of escalation as and when necessary, during the design process.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Essential Experience &amp; Qualifications:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Ideally you will have the following skills, experience and attributes;<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Able to demonstrate understanding of the main laws and regulations that affect the safety, design and operation of plant and equipment including, Nuclear Installations Act &amp; Site Licence Conditions, Health &amp; Safety at Work Act and various regulations including Safety of Machinery, CDM, LOLER, Pressure Systems, DSEAR, Ionising Radiation, Piping design codes (ASME B31.3)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to demonstrate successful development of piping design deliverables in a brownfield environment from concept \u002F Front End Engineering Design through to installation and client hand over.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to obtain SC Clearance or above and P4 Pass.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> AutoCAD experience.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> About Nuvia:<br> Nuvia is a leading international engineering, project management and services provider to the highly regulated nuclear, defence, oil &amp; gas, and science &amp; research industries. Our expertise has been developed over many years and is backed up by a highly trained, committed workforce and a wide range of specialist resources.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>NUVIA est une branche de VINCI, plus grand groupe intégré de concessions et BTP du monde. NUVIA est plus particulièrement l'entité nucléaire du Groupe VINCI et est impliqué dans le cycle de vie tout entier des installations nucléaires, du New Build au démantèlement, en passant par la maintenance et l'exploitation. NUVIA est en croissance constante, avec plus de 2700 salariés dans le monde. En moyenne, 100 hommes et femmes nous rejoignent chaque année. Maintenant, plus que jamais, nous recherchons de nouveaux talents pour soutenir la croissance du groupe.<\u002Fp>\n <p>Actemium EV is a dedicated Business Unit to Electric Vehicle Charging. Through sustained growth and the backing of VINCI Energies we are now looking to recruit a Junior Project Manager to help run the operation. The role will see help in all project activities. The ideal candidate will have some Project Management experience from within the Electric Vehicle Charging industry.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Competitive Salary + Bonus + Pension + Healthcare + Benefits<\u002Fp>\n <p> Reporting to the E-mobility Sector Manager, you will be responsible for providing technical, commercial, health &amp; Safety management for the successful delivery of commercially viable projects of varying size and complexity and in compliance with current legislation. You will be engaged at sites throughout the UK.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Key Responsibilities<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Responsible in partnership with the sector manager and our site teams, for all project activities and ultimately the profit and loss of all the contracts allocated.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Project program management – labour, materials, sub-contractors and plant.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Project Risk Management Control (during commercial and execution phases).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work with the EV team to develop new opportunities and strengthen existing client relationships.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Commercial management of projects including<\u002Fli>\n  <li> o Monthly project cost analysis\u002Fcost to complete forecast i.e. budget control including variations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Promote a Positive H&amp;S Culture, including H&amp;S Control of site set-up and task completion, CPP, Method and Risk assessments. (CDM experience preferable)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Quality Control &amp; Environmental focus during project delivery<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Value engineering approach<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Delivery of projects through to successful completion<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Present to work in line with Actemium brand values along with a can do attitude.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> About You<\u002Fp>\n <p> Already in a similar role or looking to progress, you will have a strong background in project management with demonstrable experience in electrical engineering, procurement, installation, testing, documentation and commissioning of the electrical\u002Fcivil infrastructure projects.<\u002Fp>\n <p> You will assist the Sector Manager in technical and commercial aspects of the programme roll out. You will provide expertise to guide installation engineers and contractors through installation and commissioning phases. Communicating and recording as necessary with the client, sub-contractor, and internal management as necessary.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Job Requirements:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> The candidate would be expected to have few years Project Management experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Qualifications in a technical discipline to a technician level with relevant experience, Degree or HNC\u002FHND qualified in Electrical Engineering is desirable but not a pre-requisite.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> SMSTS desired – Training can be given.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experienced in the installation of Low Voltage electrical systems in an industrial\u002FCommercial environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in supervision and planning of HV Installation (beneficial but not essential)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experienced of site survey 's leading to modifications of existing equipment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to multi-task and deliver\u002Fcontrol multiple projects simultaneously.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A self-disciplined approach, organized, structured and consistent in approach.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Specific High Power EV Charging knowledge is preferred but not essential.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge of civil construction sites also beneficial for larger scale schemes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong communication skills (written &amp; oral) are required for colleagues, customers, suppliers, sub-contractors (i.e. all levels).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Reliability, Flexibility and Dependability<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Part of the VINCI Energies Group, Actemium provide engineering design, project management, installation and commissioning of electrical, mechanical and IT services in the United Kingdom since 1907. In addition, we provide specialist maintenance operations, fully complemented with accredited safety tests and inspection services to optimise the operational efficiency and safety of our client's equipment and systems. Whilst part of a global network of 300 Business Units, Actemium UK comprises of 7 Business Units covering all of the UK &amp; RoI.<\u002Fp>\n <p>A vacancy has arisen for a Senior Mechanical Designer within the team based in Warrington. This will be to deliver mechanical work scope, production and checking, on a joint venture framework. Please note that here is the potential for the work to be on either a staff or contract basis.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Main Purpose of The Role:<\u002Fp>\n <p> The Mechanical Senior Designer is required to deliver mechanical work scope, production and checking, reporting to a Senior \u002F Principal Engineer. They will need to produce 3D models and detail drawings using Inventor \u002F AutoCAD software (including familiarity with Inventor Vault), including GA’s, Design Proposal Drawings, manufacturing details, Layout drawings, Mechanical Flow Diagrams and parts lists.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Essential Experience &amp; Qualifications:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Experience of working within a highly regulated industry, preferably within the nuclear industry.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in designing and Laying out plant\u002Fequipment and the production of mechanical flow diagrams that capture safe operational methodologies.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience using Inventor \u002F AutoCAD is essential.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience using Autodesk Vault is essential.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience of working on Alpha Plant is preferable but not essential.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience of ‘Design for Assembly’ within a nuclear facility.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The candidate will need to manage their own workload and drive completion of the work scope<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The candidate will need to be able to communicate effectively with team members and with the Client.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Minimum HNC, 10 years’ working experience in nuclear industry.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Design Tools Experience:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Microsoft Office Packages<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Inventor<\u002Fli>\n  <li> AutoCAD<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Autodesk Vault<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> Nuvia is a leading international engineering, project management and services provider to the highly regulated nuclear, defence, oil &amp; gas, and science &amp; research industries. Our expertise has been developed over many years and is backed up by a highly trained, committed workforce and a wide range of specialist resources.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>NUVIA est une branche de VINCI, plus grand groupe intégré de concessions et BTP du monde. NUVIA est plus particulièrement l'entité nucléaire du Groupe VINCI et est impliqué dans le cycle de vie tout entier des installations nucléaires, du New Build au démantèlement, en passant par la maintenance et l'exploitation. NUVIA est en croissance constante, avec plus de 2700 salariés dans le monde. En moyenne, 100 hommes et femmes nous rejoignent chaque année. Maintenant, plus que jamais, nous recherchons de nouveaux talents pour soutenir la croissance du groupe.<\u002Fp>\n scope of process design work being delivered by the BEPDT JV.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The role will also include responsibility for the update, production and ensuring the correct governance of various The role therefore requires a candidate to integrate with the existing Process IC team, bringing previous demonstrable experience in the delivery of full life cycle solutions for significant major projects. Fulfil role of ‘Designer’ under the CDM Regulations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Understanding of the SL design process related practices and experience (preferably at all stages of design lifecycle, concept and front end through to detail design and manufacture, testing, installation and commissioning).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Awareness of relevant national and international codes, specifications, standards and
