<p>About Nuvia:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Nuvia is a leading international engineering, project management and services provider to the highly regulated nuclear, defence, oil &amp; gas, and science &amp; research industries. Our expertise has been developed over many years and is backed up by a highly trained, committed workforce and a wide range of specialist resources.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Project Quality Lead Role overview:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Main purposes of the role:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Thought Leadership:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Identify and implement opportunities for improvement or good practice within the project context.<br> Use a systems thinking approach to focus the consortium on requirements and interface management.<br> Establish a governance framework (system of management) that enables the consortium to deliver to the customer requirements and drive the culture of planning for quality through the delivery process.<br> Risk Management:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Use risk management to ensure the application of appropriate assurance throughout the project delivery lifecycle.<br> Identify, report and advise on risks and opportunities to the Quality Responsible Officer.<br> Relationship Management:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Identify the various stakeholders associated with the project and build relationships with them to allow you to understand their requirements and expectations and advise on the application of governance, assurance and improvement in the project context.<br> Resource Management:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Work with the Quality Responsible Officer to establish a cultural attitude to quality within the consortium<br> Capability Development:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Ensure the system of management within the project is effective, current and conforms to the contractual requirements.<br> Knowledge, Improvement, Innovation &amp; Learning:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Capture and share knowledge and learning opportunities within the consortium and the project teams.<br> Develop and implement a quality awareness programme for key stakeholders within the consortium.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Position of the Project Quality Lead within the organisation:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Reporting to the regional Quality Lead (Quality Responsible Officer) you will be interacting with all levels of internal customers as well as liaising with suppliers and clients.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The main challenges in the role:<\u002Fp>\n <p> The consortium delivery team is based on multiple sites across the UK and France, with the customer interfaces in France and Spain. The quality team needs to be able to work flexibly and facilitate multi-site working through using technology in process design to overcome communication challenges.<br> The consortium is formed of three organisations with the addition of a number of sub-contractors. Designing shared processes needs to take into account the cultural differences between the companies, the language difficulties, and the existing established ways of working.<br> Time management – you need to be aware of the time budgets for each task and work within them<br> Ideally you will have the following skills, experience and attributes…<\u002Fp>\n <p> Experience of developing governance arrangements<br> Experience in working within complex project structures<br> Experience of leading internal audit programmes to ISO9001 or equivalent (ideally lead auditor qualified)<br> Effective communication at all levels, written and verbal, including experience in preparation of quality plans and control plans<br> Able to work with complex issues to tight deadlines and within budget.<br> Experience of a regulated environment is prefered.<br> A highly developed problem solving ability<br> Be experienced in using appropriate quality tools to identify risks and opportunities<br> Be approachable, organised, collaborative, and communicative.<br> Good attention to detail<br> Highly task orientated and goal focused.<br> Innovative in approach.<br> Commercially aware.<br> To provide a quality &amp; service driven attitude.<br> Working for us:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Would you like to work for a well-recognised international Company? If so, Nuvia offers a wide range of career opportunities for the right people who can help us to achieve our vision: to be recognised as the world class provider of whole life solutions to the nuclear industry’s most complex technical challenges, from new build, through operations to decommissioning.<\u002Fp>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> Subsidiary of VINCI Construction, and division of the world-leading VINCI Group, NUVIA is an international company that operates world-wide on highly regulated and sensitive industrial sites, and has done for decades. We have been involved in<br> all the major nuclear projects in the world thanks to our solid and historical expertise.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Today, NUVIA is a key-partner for highly demanding industries that place regulatory requirements and safety at the top of their priorities. Our clients can also count on NUVIA for cutting-edge support services and solutions. Freyssinet forms part of the Soletanche Freyssinet Group, a name that is respected worldwide for delivering innovative solutions and pushing the envelope of civil and structural engineering achievement. Originally a specialist in bridge components and post-tensioning, Freyssinet has successfully expanded its portfolio of products and services into repair, protection and strengthening of structures: specialising in diagnostic surveys, repairs, refurbishment, bridge bearings, expansion joints and cathodic protection to reinforced concrete in the building, civil and marine sectors. Our employees are at the heart of everything Freyssinet does. Our motivated and dedicated workforce is a key driver of the exceptional service, skill and quality Freyssinet is renowned for, delivering complex and pioneering projects all around the UK. We believe in providing our employees with excellent benefits and place great importance on people development, helping our people to achieve their full potential and enjoy interesting and rewarding careers. <p>VINCI Construction Terrassement Grands Projets est un concepteur-constructeur historique et reconnu de grandes infrastructures linéaires, en France et à l’international.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Au fil de notre histoire nous avons intégré les compétences et expertises complémentaires, nécessaires à la maîtrise de l’ensemble de la chaîne de valeur des projets. La connaissance approfondie de Balfour Beatty du secteur des transports au Royaume-Uni est parfaitement complémentaire de l’expertise de VINCI en matière de grands projets, tels que la LGV SEA Tours-Bordeaux récemment achevée en France, ou encore plusieurs chantiers d'infrastructures ferroviaires au Royaume-Uni.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Pour contribuer au succès de ce projet, nous vous proposons l’opportunité en Angleterre en tant qu'Ingénieur Travaux.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Sous la responsabilité du Directeur de travaux, vos missions consisteront entre autre à :<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Etablir les méthodes et procédures de travaux,<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Encadrer un ou plusieurs chefs de chantier et\u002Fou conducteurs de travaux,<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Gérer les moyens humains et personnel affectés à vos chantiers,<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Etablir et suivre les planning de votre secteur,<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assurer le suivi budgétaire,<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Respecter et faire respecter les règles de sécurité.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Votre profil :<\u002Fp>\n <p> Diplômé d’une école d’ingénieur ou issu d'une formation de type BAC +5.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Vous êtes rigoureux, curieux, organisé et avez une bonne capacité de synthèse et le sens du profit.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Vous avez le goût du travail en équipe et vous vous adaptez facilement y compris à des cultures différentes de la vôtre.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Vous maîtrisez l’anglais et êtes capable d’animer des réunions et de négocier avec les parties prenantes.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Partout dans le monde, nous concevons et construisons des infrastructures d'envergure qui s'intègrent aux territoires en faisant de la prise en compte des environnements préexistants – biodiversité, populations, infrastructures - le préalable de tout projet. Nous combinons une approche sur-mesure de nos métiers du terrassement et de nos expertises - conception, géotechnique, topographie, environnement pour assurer la performance globale de chaque réalisation. Nos équipes expertes, intégrées sur les projets, sont animées par la découverte de nouveaux territoires, la passion de leur métier, la soif de transmettre et leur contribution à des projets qui font sens. Notre passion de la terre et de la préservation du vivant, notre ambition de construire des projets durables connectant les territoires et contribuant à la résilience climatique, sont les fils conducteurs de notre quotidien. forecasts.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Produce short-term forecast lookaheads between forecast exercises.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Meetings held with Line Manager to review financial forecast results.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Supporting group reporting requirements where necessary<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> Period end processes \n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Ensure turnover &amp; profit is accurately assessed in line with accounting standards each month end.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Prepare &amp; review accruals (both project and overhead), invoice schedules &amp; invoices.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Manage customer &amp; supplier retentions in accordance with contract terms.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Assess a broad scope of funded projects, undertaking periodic performance reviews<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Prepare accurate financial results &amp; commentaries to an agreed timetable.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Monthly reporting of financial results &amp; KPI’s including explanations of variances against Budgets and\u002For forecasts.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Monthly meetings held with Management teams to review financial results.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Providing input into business report and other higher-level reporting as required<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> Business &amp; Project support\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Provide financial advice and make recommendations to all levels and ensure compliance with financial procedures. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Production of ad hoc reports as required.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Review current processes and modify where necessary to ensure compliance whilst providing accurate information in a manner suitable for viewing by all management levels.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Provide support and advice relating to financial system and the information available.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Production of monthly project\u002Fcontract summary reports &amp; governance checks for business lines.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Assist Project teams\u002FBusiness Managers with the financial control of both customers funded &amp; overhead projects.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Monitor and act if required to ensure good cashflow management – i.e., prompt invoicing, overdue debts. Advise Senior management of any potential issues.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Review payroll information against resource charge out rates to ensure procedure compliance.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Assisting in Company &amp; Customer audit queries where required.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> Supervision of data maintenance\u002Fintegrity\n  <br> Manage data integrity including ensuring:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Projects, work orders and connection controls are opened\u002Fclosed in Unit4 Business World (formally Agresso) promptly and in accordance with contract terms.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Project budgets &amp; contract values are maintained in the accounting system.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> Subsidiary of VINCI Construction, and division of the world-leading VINCI Group, NUVIA is an international company that operates world-wide on highly regulated and sensitive industrial sites, and has done for decades. We have been involved in<br> all the major nuclear projects in the world thanks to our solid and historical expertise.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Today, NUVIA is a key-partner for highly demanding industries that place regulatory requirements and safety at the top of their priorities. Our clients can also count on NUVIA for cutting-edge support services and solutions. With three ranges of NUVIATech products, NUVIA is a leading designer and supplier of sophisticated radiation protection and detection instruments, as valuable in Healthcare, protection, as in radioactivity geolocation<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>NUVIA est une branche de VINCI, plus grand groupe intégré de concessions et BTP du monde. NUVIA est plus particulièrement l'entité nucléaire du Groupe VINCI et est impliqué dans le cycle de vie tout entier des installations nucléaires, du New Build au démantèlement, en passant par la maintenance et l'exploitation. NUVIA est en croissance constante, avec plus de 2700 salariés dans le monde. En moyenne, 100 hommes et femmes nous rejoignent chaque année. Maintenant, plus que jamais, nous recherchons de nouveaux talents pour soutenir la croissance du groupe.<\u002Fp>\n <p>The Engineering Manager will be based in either Warrington or Cumbria with some remote working, 3 days at either site is preferred.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Role Description:<\u002Fp>\n <p> The provision of Design IC resource with the skills, knowledge and experience to discharge engineering management (PSEM) and CDM Principal Designer duties. The resource will support the area on scoped work and will be allocated to work on behalf of the Remediation Beta Gamma Design Lead.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The Remediation Beta Gamma Programme includes a number decommissioning projects being undertaken in various legacy facilities on the Sellafield site. The design engineering team support these projects from the study stage all the way through to completion of project execution. Design may be undertaken by DSA teams or as design and execution packages issued to the Decommissioning Delivery Partnership (DDP).<\u002Fp>\n <p> Defined Work scope to be delivered for a study \u002F project \u002F task will be in line with the Management System and typically include:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Design Leadership and design assurance (IC) oversight on behalf of Sellafield Limited as part of the DSA integrated Team.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Feasibility assessments.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Production or contribution to the development of project delivery strategy and initiation documents e.g. Project Functional Specification, Verification Plan, Project Execution Plan, Business Case.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provision of Specifications and input to Works Information (WI) and tender evaluations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provision and \u002F or review of estimates and schedules for design delivery.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Identification of risks and contribution to risk management processes.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provision of Pre-Construction Information (PCI)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Production of CDM Health &amp; Safety Files.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Discharge of the CDM Principal Designer responsibilities on behalf of Sellafield Ltd.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Production of Design Risks Assessments.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Essential Experience &amp; Qualifications:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Essential Skills:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Minimum BEng\u002FBSc Engineering (or equivalent).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in Nuclear Design.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to achieve Baseline security clearance (minimum).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to provide intelligent customer oversight to Engineering Design.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Fulfil role of ‘Designer’ under the CDM Regulations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Understanding of the SL design process related practices and experience (preferably at all stages of design lifecycle, concept and front end through to detail design and manufacture, testing, installation and commissioning).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good verbal and written communication skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Pragmatic approach to problem solving and ability to apply ‘Engineering Fit for Purpose Judgement’ where appropriate.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good working knowledge of MS Office products.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Desirable Skills:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Understanding of NEC3 contracts.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge of the Sellafield Ltd Management System (SLMS).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Baseline security cleared<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience of implementing R&amp;D \u002F technical work into plant design.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> Nuvia is a leading international engineering, project management and services provider to the highly regulated nuclear, defence, oil &amp; gas, and science &amp; research industries. NUVIA est plus particulièrement l'entité nucléaire du Groupe VINCI et est impliqué dans le cycle de vie tout entier des installations nucléaires, du New Build au démantèlement, en passant par la maintenance et l'exploitation. NUVIA est en croissance constante, avec plus de 2700 salariés dans le monde. En moyenne, 100 hommes et femmes nous rejoignent chaque année. <p>Part of the VINCI Energies Group, Actemium provide engineering design, project management, installation and commissioning of electrical, mechanical and IT services in the United Kingdom since 1907. In addition, we provide specialist maintenance operations, fully complemented with accredited safety tests and inspection services to optimise the operational efficiency and safety of our client's equipment and systems. Whilst part of a global network of 2 000 Business Units, Actemium UK comprises of 22 Business Units covering the UK &amp; RoI.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Actemium EV is a leading infrastructure provider and due to continued, sustained growth we are looking we’re looking for passionate and talented individuals to join our team, offering continual professional development in return for dedication to the job and a passion to contribute to the success of the company.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Competitive Salary + Bonus + Car Allowance + Pension + Share Scheme + EV Car Scheme (Salary Sacrifice) + Benefits<\u002Fp>\n <p> Role<br> <br> Regarding the development of our company we are looking for someone to develop new customers in the area of the north of England and Scotland.<\u002Fp>\n <p> With electrical background you will have three main missions: Chasing new opportunities, managing the projects from the beginning to the end and control the profitability of your projects.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Reporting to the E-mobility Sector Manager in Coventry, you will also be responsible for providing technical, commercial, health &amp; Safety management for the successful delivery of commercially viable projects of varying size and complexity and in compliance with current legislation.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Key Responsibilities<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Responsible of the business development of the north area<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Responsible for all project activities and ultimately the profit and loss of all the contracts allocated.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Project program management – labour, materials, sub-contractors and plant.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Project Risk Management Control (during commercial and execution phases).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work with the EV team to develop new opportunities and strengthen existing client relationships.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Commercial management of projects including<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Monthly project cost analysis\u002Fcost to complete forecast i.e. budget control including variations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Promote a Positive H&amp;S Culture, including H&amp;S Control of site set-up and task completion, CPP, Method and Risk assessments. (CDM experience preferable)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Quality Control &amp; Environmental focus during project delivery<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Value engineering approach<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Delivery of projects through to successful completion<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Present to work in line with Actemium brand values along with a can do attitude.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Already in a similar role or looking to progress, you will have a strong background in project management with demonstrable experience in electrical engineering, procurement, installation, testing, documentation and commissioning of the electrical\u002Fcivil infrastructure projects.<\u002Fp>\n <p> You like to develop new opportunities and develop new customers. You have good entrepreneurial skills and you like to work in a dynamic market, with autonomy and liability.<\u002Fp>\n <p> You will assist the Business unit manager in the development of a new sector. You will provide expertise to guide installation engineers and contractors through installation and commissioning phases. Communicating and recording as necessary with the client, sub-contractor, and internal management as necessary.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Job Requirements<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> The candidate would be expected to have few years Project Management experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Qualifications in a technical discipline to a technician level with relevant experience, Degree or HNC\u002FHND qualified in Electrical Engineering is desirable but not a pre-requisite.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> SMSTS desired – Training can be given.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experienced in the installation of Low Voltage electrical systems in an industrial\u002FCommercial environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in supervision and planning of HV Installation (beneficial but not essential)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experienced of site survey 's leading to modifications of existing equipment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to multi-task and deliver\u002Fcontrol multiple projects simultaneously.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A self-disciplined approach, organized, structured and consistent in approach.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Specific High Power EV Charging knowledge is preferred but not essential.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge of civil construction sites also beneficial for larger scale schemes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong communication skills (written &amp; oral) are required for colleagues, customers, suppliers, sub-contractors (i.e. all levels).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Reliability, Flexibility and Dependability<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> The role will see become responsible for all project activities. The ideal candidate will have Project Management experience from within the electrical engineering or infrastructure industry.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Part of the VINCI Energies Group, Actemium provide engineering design, project management, installation and commissioning of electrical, mechanical and IT services in the United Kingdom since 1907. <p>Actemium Rail (Birmingham) are looking to recruit Full-Time, Project Manager in Electrical Installation (Rail), to Support our ongoing rail sector growth plan. We are currently seeing an increase in project awards for HS2 and Network Rail new builds, alongside infrastructure enhancements, resulting in a need to strengthen our in-house rail team.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Competitive Salary + company car or car allowance + healthcare + pension plan + company share scheme<\u002Fp>\n <p> Responsible for all aspects of the project from conception to completion. The candidate would be expected to have at least 5 years of experience within this type of role. Knowledge of Rail processes and procedures would be advantageous but not essential.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Based at our Birmingham location, typical duties and responsibilities include:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n technical aspects of their projects.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Participates in the preparation of the Business Unit's annual budget, Shared Strategic Plan (SSP) and their individual commercial action plan.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ensures that customer complaints and non-conformities are recorded, and corrective action is taken.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Develops and manages key customer relationships, through regular reviews of contract performance with customers, understanding and managing needs and gaps.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Proactively delivers a quality installation to the satisfaction of our customers.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Reviews and approves project execution plans, health and safety plans, environmental plans, and safe method of work plans.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Seeks opportunities for business growth both within and outside the existing contract base<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Already a in a similar role or looking to progress from your current role, you will have a strong background in electrical engineering with demonstrable experience in design development, procurement, installation, testing, documentation and commissioning of the electrical element of projects<\u002Fp>\n <p> <p>We are actively recruiting for Technical personnel (typically 3-6 years' experience) to support the Hinkley Point C project. This is a new exciting permanent opportunity based in Bristol.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Description of the expected service:<\u002Fp>\n <p> The “end of erection” on HPC is a milestone also described as the handover from MEH <br> Programme, managing site erection and installation, to Commissionning Programme. <br> This milestone is generically identified as HO4.<br> The purpose of the mission is to support HPC (JDO, Plant Integration and Programmes) <br> during the detailed definition of HO4:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Content (data &amp; document)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maturity \u002F updates of the design (site compliant)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Configuration status, in relation with the End of Erection Status Report<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Split of HO4 (per erection area or commissionning packages)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Associated schedule<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> This will then allow SZC to identify potential gaps with the expected data and documents required to initialise the civil, layout and MEH replication sequence.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> In addition, as some of the MEH execution design will be reintegrated into the RD <br> Layout 3D Model, RD design being superseded by the execution designer’s. Both HPC <br> and SZC need to define a process to allow the implementation of new requirements, <br> through a design change, without relying on the RD Layout 3D Model (as it will be <br> superseded by the execution designer’s). The way to instruct those new requirements <br> to the execution designer needs also to be defined.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> In coordination with HPC JDO, the purpose of the mission is to define such process for <br> SZC. Test cases are expected to be then run to assess the robustness of the proposed <br> process.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Finally, the mission will support the first handovers from HPC to SZC. A self-assessment <br> of the handover process is expected mid-2023, leading to a potential update.<br> Such processes regarding other HPC input data to be used for SZC needs could also be <br> launched in the same kind of approach, when the both projects overall schedules and <br> interactions will progressively evolve.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Required Technical Skills:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Configuration management knowledge.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> General installation.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> Nuvia is a leading international engineering, project management and services provider to the highly regulated nuclear, defence, oil &amp; gas, and science &amp; research industries. Our expertise has been developed over many years and is backed up by a highly trained, committed workforce and a wide range of specialist resources.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>NUVIA est une branche de VINCI, plus grand groupe intégré de concessions et BTP du monde. NUVIA est plus particulièrement l'entité nucléaire du Groupe VINCI et est impliqué dans le cycle de vie tout entier des installations nucléaires, du New Build au démantèlement, en passant par la maintenance et l'exploitation. NUVIA est en croissance constante, avec plus de 2700 salariés dans le monde. En moyenne, 100 hommes et femmes nous rejoignent chaque année. Maintenant, plus que jamais, nous recherchons de nouveaux talents pour soutenir la croissance du groupe.<\u002Fp>\n <p>About us<\u002Fp>\n <p> Omexom is a brand through which VINCI Energies undertakes its Transmission &amp; Distribution activities. Omexom UK and ROI is a community of incredible people, empowered to deliver the promises of digital and energy revolutions. Our vision to create a better future sits at the heart of everything we do.<\u002Fp>\n <p> At Omexom you are free to be who you are and what you want to be. You can be part of a community that fosters entrepreneurial spirit and supports you in your personal development.<\u002Fp>\n <p> We offer a flexible working environment with strong benefits such as 25 days holidays, matched pension contributions, a generous company share scheme and healthcare cover. Our culture is reflected in our values which we embody by empowering and bringing together amazing people.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The Role:<\u002Fp>\n <p> A Senior Project Manager is required by the Omexom Substation Business Unit to play a key part of our organisational success, ensuring commitments to our customers are delivered on time and to the highest standard.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The job holder will have a consistent track record of project delivery along with demonstrable experience in developing diverse teams.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Reporting to the Operations Manager, duties will include, but are not limited to:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Ownership of deliverables relating to time, cost, and quality, ensuring safe delivery of projects.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Lead, develop and support teams operating on a variety of projects.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Use excellent communication skills to run and engage with internal and external partners in a timely manner.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Professionally represent Omexom, both individually and as part of a team, in a wide range of situations with internal and external stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Lead projects to the requirements set out within our governance framework for project delivery.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work closely with and as part of the Sales team providing expertise for bid opportunities throughout the sales phase including creation of detailed project plans.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide and manage objectives to project team members (Procurement, Engineering, Construction, etc) to ensure all deliverables are monitored and achieved in accordance with the plan.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Project cost control at all times, ensuring pre-determined levels of productivity are achieved.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Essential Skills and Competencies:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Excellent communication skills, both written and oral<\u002Fli>\n  <li> HV Substation experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Educated to degree level (preferably in an engineering, business or project management discipline)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience of managing budgets<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experienced in planning works in the most efficient manner<\u002Fli>\n  <li> understanding of safety and quality management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The ability to engage at a specific and detailed level with key tasks, evidenced by those tasks being executed in a highly efficient manner.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> APM, PRINCE2 or PMI qualifications are desirable.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Expert of energy technologies and IT services, VINCI Energies (64,500 employees, €10.2 billion of turnover) design, implement and maintain solutions to the industry, service sector and local communities. In the United Kingdom and Republic of Ireland, VINCI Energies provides electrical design, project management, installation and maintenance services since 1907. Through its 16 closely networked Business Units, VINCI Energies operates in 4 different sectors: Infrastructure, Industry, Telecommunications and building services.<\u002Fp>\n <p>Actemium ICP Business Unit is working on designing and delivering utility connections to the E-mobility and Industrial sectors, specifically electrical connections. We provide LV and 11kv Connection to the grid for our customers across UK, who are looking to recruit a Senior Design Engineer. To be part of the HV Engineering design team in delivering commercially and technically <br> accurate designs in a timely manner.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Competitive Salary + Bonus + Pension+ Benefits<\u002Fp>\n <p> Job Duties:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Produce:<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> a project specific DNO\u002F IDNO\u002F Private network electrical design<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Bill of quantities of equipment in line with relevant IEC, DNO, IDNO, and client specifications<\u002Fli>\n  <li> cable calculations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Technical reports to accompany the design submissions detailing the specifics of the proposed connection arrangement<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Balancing and harmonics studies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Earthing layouts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> AC and DC schematic drawings, cable block diagrams, cable and termination schedules<\u002Fli>\n  <li> High-level specifications for control, protection, and SCADA systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Detailed specifications for high voltage equipment including transformers, switchboards, circuit breakers, disconnectors, current and voltage transformers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Detailed specifications for ancillary plant and equipment associated with high voltage substations including auxiliary transformers, battery systems, LVAC boards, and multicore cables.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Review client specifications<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Design HV substation layouts and elevations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assess client’s HV network – site visits will sometime be required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assess DNO EV charging capacity maps to develop future EV infrastructure<\u002Fli>\n  <li> DNO and IDNO POC and G99 applications<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Self- Determination POC<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Skills and Qualifications:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Degree in Electrical Engineering(Desirable)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> IEng Member of The IET<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Several years HV Substation design to NERS requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Chartered Engineer or working towards Chartership<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in protection and grading studies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Working knowledge of British Standards and G81’s<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Working knowledge of office software – MS word, excel, PowerPoint, project<\u002Fli>\n  <li> In-depth knowledge of AutoCAD and Amtech<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Advantageous: working knowledge of design software: Revit, CDEGS etc<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Part of the VINCI Energies Group, Actemium provide engineering design, project management, installation and commissioning of electrical, mechanical and IT services in the United Kingdom since 1907. In addition, we provide specialist maintenance operations, fully complemented with accredited safety tests and inspection services to optimise the operational efficiency and safety of our client's equipment and systems. Whilst part of a global network of 300 Business Units, Actemium UK comprises of 7 Business Units covering all of the UK &amp; RoI.<\u002Fp>\n <p>NUVIA have a new vacancy for a permanent Mechanical Specialist who would grow into the field of Nuclear Waste Packages (Type B \u002F IP), based at either our Harwell (Oxfordshire) or Risley (Warrington) offices, balanced with home working. We are growing capability across our locations and a number of roles are available dependent on experience.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Mechanical Specialist: Role Overview<\u002Fp>\n <p> As a Mechanical Specialist specialising in Engineering (nuclear waste packages) &amp; Licensing you will join our burgeoning team which you will build experience and design techniques and appreciate the whole life-cycle of engineering consultancy projects. Most of this is achieved by day-to-day guidance in live projects, some big and some small. This will include initial concept design through optioneering, detailed design, substantiation of designs, license applications to regulators, manufacturing of the waste packages across the UK, and supporting operational fleets.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The successful applicant may be a good graduate or apprentice who has completed a scheme, and is now looking for a new challenge, or a slightly more experienced specialist that is keen to stay in a engineering generating position.<\u002Fp>\n <p> As well as receiving first-class training and support in design and licensing activities such as the implications of structural, impact, thermal, shielding and criticality assessments, you’ll work alongside and learn from some of the most respected and highly qualified professionals in their field. Your training will be organised to provide you with the skills and experience to apply for membership of the IMechE and become a professional accredited engineer.<\u002Fp>\n <p> You will be an active team member in a supportive work environment, contributing to the achievement of real business objectives and assigned to live projects - some of which are the largest and most exciting projects taking place within the nuclear industry.<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> As part of the team you will gain the experience required to grow in responsibility for delivering and planning engineering tasks of increasing size \u002Fas your career progresses. The area of Engineering and Licensing (in particular, Licensing Assessment\u002FApplications and Hand Calculations) is treated as a part of the formal design process and is also vital for achieving regulatory acceptance for our customers.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will interface with other engineering disciplines; project managers, production engineers, inspectors, nuclear safety and engineering analysis specialists.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The portfolio of projects has many waste packages in manufacturing phase or recently manufactured, so you get to see your hard work come to life!<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Position of the Specialist within the organisation:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Reporting to Senior Specialists \u002F Container Approvals Manager and line management by Managing Consultant.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Often managing a small team of designers or design engineers.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Interaction with engineers\u002FQA of other areas in the business, both internal and external.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Skills &amp; Qualifications<\u002Fp>\n <p> Technical abilities are essential, so you will need a minimum of a 2:1 Masters or bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field. We look for those with a passion for engineering and problem solving and would have an interest in designs, materials, manufacturing, how to operate &amp; maintain mechanical components, and the essentials of how radiation shielding works in practice. It would benefit if you covered &amp; enjoyed degree modules such as mechanics of structures and dynamics, preferably including CAD.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Just as important are your behaviours; we are looking out for candidates with great communication skills, who are proactive, focused, and with a willingness to learn.<\u002Fp>\n <p> To support you:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Each developing individual is assigned a mentor and a line manager, which ensures that you receive the structured support and guidance necessary for your professional development.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Exposure to a variety of projects.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Opportunities for role rotation depending on preference, ensuring a well-rounded development,<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> Nuvia is a leading international consultancy, engineering, project management and services provider to the highly regulated nuclear, defence, and science &amp; research industries. Our expertise has been developed over many years and is backed up by our highly trained and committed workforce who have a wide range of specialist skills and knowledge. Nuvia is currently recruiting to deliver our live projects and future projects in the nuclear legacy, existing nuclear operations &amp; decommissioning arena.<\u002Fp>\n <p> What’s in it for you:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Competitive salary<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Bonus scheme<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Pension plan<\u002Fli>\n  <li> 25 days holidays<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Hybrid and Agile working schemes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Healthcare (optional after one year)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Professional Subscription covered<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Cycle to work scheme<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Discounted gym membership and social activities<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>NUVIA est une branche de VINCI, plus grand groupe intégré de concessions et BTP du monde. NUVIA est plus particulièrement l'entité nucléaire du Groupe VINCI et est impliqué dans le cycle de vie tout entier des installations nucléaires, du New Build au démantèlement, en passant par la maintenance et l'exploitation. NUVIA est en croissance constante, avec plus de 2700 salariés dans le monde. En moyenne, 100 hommes et femmes nous rejoignent chaque année. Maintenant, plus que jamais, nous recherchons de nouveaux talents pour soutenir la croissance du groupe.<\u002Fp>\n <p>NUVIA have a new vacancy for a permanent Designer who would work with the team of Nuclear Waste Packages (Type B \u002F IP) Specialists, based at our Harwell (Oxfordshire) office, balanced with home working. We are growing capability across our locations and a number of roles are available dependent on experience. Please note we will consider candidates on a staff or contract basis.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Purpose of the job:<\u002Fp>\n <p> To provide discipline focused support to the project delivery team. The Designer is responsible for the production of drawings and basic calculations for the Transport Container team. The Designer is required to support the production of project deliverables where necessary.<\u002Fp>\n <p> As a Designer in the Transport Container team you will join our burgeoning team which you will deploy your experience and design techniques and appreciate the whole life-cycle of engineering consultancy projects. This will include initial concept design through optioneering, detailed design, substantiation of designs, support to manufacturing of the waste packages across the UK, and supporting operational fleets.<\u002Fp>\n <p> As well as receiving first-class training and support in design activities, you’ll work alongside and learn from some of the most respected and highly qualified professionals in their field.<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> You will be an active team member in a supportive work environment, contributing to the achievement of real business objectives and assigned to live projects - some of which are the largest and most exciting projects taking place within the nuclear industry.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The area of Engineering (in particular, designs that can be manufactured) is treated as a part of the formal design process and is also vital for achieving regulatory acceptance for our customers.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will interface with other engineering disciplines; project managers, production engineers, inspectors, nuclear safety, licensing and engineering analysis specialists.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The portfolio of projects has many waste packages in manufacturing phase or recently manufactured, so you get to see your hard work come to life!<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Reports to:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Senior Technical Specialist or Container Approvals Manager.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Key Accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Development of designs, using AutoCAD and\u002For Inventor.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Duties and Requirements:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Essential:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> A recognised Engineering Certificate such as HNC \u002F HND,<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge of the fundamentals within your engineering discipline,<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Use of CAD systems (e.g. AutoCAD and\u002For Inventor),<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to work to tight deadlines,<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A strong team player.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Desirable skills:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Experience of design within a highly regulated industry,<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrable competence gained in a design delivery position,<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A full UK driving licence.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> Why Nuvia?<\u002Fp>\n <p> Nuvia - a subsidiary of VINCI construction - is an international company that operates across highly regulated sectors including Civil Nuclear and has a strong presence and history of delivery at nuclear sites in the UK and internationally.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Nuvia is a performance-driven company that is committed to the development of its people within a culture of safety, innovation, and excellence.<\u002Fp>\n <p> What’s in it for you:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Competitive salary<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Bonus scheme<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Pension plan<\u002Fli>\n  <li> 25 days holidays<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Hybrid and Agile working schemes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Healthcare (optional after one year)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Professional Subscription covered<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Cycle to work scheme<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> The Job Description is a broad statement of the purpose, scope, and responsibilities essential to performing within the role to a required standard. The role and responsibilities defined within will change with technology, working practices and redefining of roles, and the process will be reviewed as changes demand. The format does not require every single task to be recorded, instead the Job Description is written in a ‘generic’ style that permits flexibility but defines the boundaries of responsibility and accountability.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Nuvia UK is committed towards equality in employment.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>NUVIA est une branche de VINCI, plus grand groupe intégré de concessions et BTP du monde. NUVIA est plus particulièrement l'entité nucléaire du Groupe VINCI et est impliqué dans le cycle de vie tout entier des installations nucléaires, du New Build au démantèlement, en passant par la maintenance et l'exploitation. NUVIA est en croissance constante, avec plus de 2700 salariés dans le monde. En moyenne, 100 hommes et femmes nous rejoignent chaque année. Maintenant, plus que jamais, nous recherchons de nouveaux talents pour soutenir la croissance du groupe.<\u002Fp>\n <p>We are actively recruiting for an experienced Senior HVAC Engineer, to support the AXIOM framework. This is a new exciting opportunity based in either Warrington or Westlakes, with remote working available.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Project Description:<\u002Fp>\n <p> The HVAC category focuses on issues relating to the heating, ventilation and air conditioning of plants and buildings across the Sellafield site. Due to the sensitive nature of the project further details will be provided on request.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Role Description:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Support to HVAC Categorised Projects will be required to support the HVAC Principal Engineer \u002F SL RE to deliver numerous HVAC Categorised Studies &amp; Projects. The role will involve the production and checking of engineering deliverables to support design development through concept and preliminary phases, and into detail design, and assistance during installation and commissioning borne design queries.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The role requires knowledge and experience in project delivery with experience of optioneering and front-end design and detail design. Specific responsibilities are:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Production of technical and engineering reports.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Manage Production of Mech\u002FHVAC Drawings<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Production of HVAC\u002FBuilding services calculations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Willing\u002Fable to conduct site survey &amp; familiarisation at Sellafield site (Cumbria).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Working with a small integrated design team in the delivery of design packages against milestones.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to estimate hours for scope changes or additional works along with outlining supporting schedule for the discipline.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support the Project in all aspects of HVAC and Building Services with knowledge and experience in nuclear standards and processes, specifically the delivery of the design of HVAC Systems or modification to existing HVAC Systems.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to be client facing and demonstrate confidence as a subject matter expert hence able to support all stakeholders. This role requires interface with Integrated Design Team, facility team (including systems engineering), other project functions and must work closely throughout project phases. The ability to work collaboratively in a team environment is essential<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Essential Experience &amp; Qualifications:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Degree in Building Services Engineering or significant HVAC design experience.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ideally chartered or working towards chartership.<br> Knowledge and experience of UK regulations is essential.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge of nuclear standards and site procedures (preferred but not essential).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Awareness of EG_0_1738_1 - Ventilation of Radioactive Areas.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Design of ventilation systems from basic principles which shall include but not limited to: -<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Review of room data sheets.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Calculating airflow rates to enable duct sizing and pressure loss calculations for fan duties.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Develop HVAC Fire and Control Philosophy.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge &amp; experience in nuclear containment ventilation.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in the production of HVAC system design deliverables, specifying heat rejection plant (eg. air \u002F water cooled condensers, heat pumps and heat recovery systems of varying types. The design of HVAC systems for cooling industrial process environments.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Production of system schematics \u002F Engineering Flow Diagrams (EFDs).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge of steam and condensate processes and steam system design.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Use of industry standard software such as Hevacomp and Pipenet.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Thermal modelling experience would be an advantage.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Demonstrable experience in a similar role\u002Fenvironment, with recent relevant exposure to work in the nuclear industry.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good communication skills and ability to work with other team members<br> Competent Report writing skills: clearly and concisely reporting findings. <br> Comfortable working under time and cost constraints.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> Nuvia is a leading international engineering, project management and services provider to the highly regulated nuclear, defence, oil &amp; gas, and science &amp; research industries. Our expertise has been developed over many years and is backed up by a highly trained, committed workforce and a wide range of specialist resources.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>NUVIA est une branche de VINCI, plus grand groupe intégré de concessions et BTP du monde. NUVIA est plus particulièrement l'entité nucléaire du Groupe VINCI et est impliqué dans le cycle de vie tout entier des installations nucléaires, du New Build au démantèlement, en passant par la maintenance et l'exploitation. NUVIA est en croissance constante, avec plus de 2700 salariés dans le monde. En moyenne, 100 hommes et femmes nous rejoignent chaque année. <p>Actemium Automation is a control and automation systems integrator. We operate from 12 offices in England and employ 250 people. We are part of VINCI Energies; a £12.5 billion organisation and we are looking to recruit a Senior Software Controls Systems Engineer to join our Worksop office.<\u002Fp>\n <p> (Competitive Salary + Bonus + Pension + Share Scheme + Electric Vehicle Car Scheme + Benefits)<\u002Fp>\n <p> Actemium Automation Worksop is a Premier System Integration company that specialises in PLC and DCS solutions. We are considered to be a relaxed and friendly company that values an ethical approach to business that supports a collaborative partnership with our clients and sets us apart from our competitors.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Due to our continued success and growth. We are actively seeking new talent to join our already successful team based in Worksop.<\u002Fp>\n <p> In order to be successful in the role of Senior Software Controls Systems Engineer, you will be able to demonstrate significant experience of delivering projects through the complete cycle from start to finish. Supporting Engineers with their growth and development by direct mentoring. You will be able to show how you have liaised with clients and suppliers to ensure that projects are delivered on time and on budget. You will have the ability to design and produce a range of documents for the engineering team as well as being able to compile DCS, PLC, HMI and SCADA Software. Other functions of the role include performing validation and software testing with customers, carrying out onsite commissioning and supporting the tender process for new projects<\u002Fp>\n <p> Main Responsibilities:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Actively participates in the whole life cycle of delivering projects, from start to finish.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Foster great relationships with customers, suppliers and colleagues.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Produce design and test documentation.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Develop PLC, HMI and SCADA software.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Perform testing with customers.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Carry out on-site commissioning.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Compile training manuals and run customer training sessions.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Required Skills and Experience:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Intermediate-level experience with Siemens and other major brands of PLC and SCADA\u002FHMI platforms, with an appetite to learn new technologies.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ideally have experience of Factory Automation and Power Management Systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Several years' experience writing software and working with customers delivery projects.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good understanding of setting up, commissioning, and fault finding of industrial networks (Profibus, ProfiNet, Ethernet) preferred, but not essential.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Understanding of web based technologies and HTML 5<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience working in an engineering environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Thinks outside the box and pushes the boundaries.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Highly motivated, organised and flexible.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Positive, personable and happy team player.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to work unsupervised.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good working knowledge of Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel and Outlook.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must be eligible to work in the UK.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> In return we can offer you the opportunity to work with a team of forward thinking and progressive people and be part of a business that values its workforce and provides a relaxed and friendly approach. We provide ongoing training and development to all our employees. presentation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure that all-relevant Health and Safety Procedures are adhered to<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong team leadership skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Team management skills – an interest in developing the skills and knowledge of your team in line with business goals<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Project awareness and the ability to evaluate projects every step of the way ready to present to management (EV reviews)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Contract Management and Negotiation ability<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Commercial acumen to perform earned value analysis<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Customer site visits as and when required<br> Preferable:<br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Review of the design and testing of control systems in accordance with agreed specifications, applicable <\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>standards and legislative requirements.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Skill and Qualifications:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Qualified to HNC \u002F HND \u002F Degree level in a relevant discipline and in-depth experience in system integration OR substantial experience in systems integration.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> High level of ability to understand and produce control system design documents.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong understanding of technical project life cycle.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good to high knowledge of Software Experience with:<br> o System for in process and manufacturing environments<br> o PLC based control system architecture<br> o PLC, HMI &amp; <p>A vacancy has arisen for a permanent Senior Specialist with specialist experience in the field of Nuclear Transport Packaging, within the team based mostly in our Harwell office. We are looking to recruit specialists with a passion for engineering to join our growing skilled team.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p> Senior Specialist (Transport Packaging) Role Overview:<\u002Fp>\n <p> The Senior Specialist is principally a hands-on design and licensing\u002Fassessment documentation based role with a degree of team leadership. The Senior Specialist can be responsible for delivering a package of work within a project. You will have frequent liaison with other disciplines in the engineering team, inspectors, sites and within the client. Senior Specialists are the main interface between Container Approvals Manager and hands-on design &amp; licensing engineers.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Senior Specialists at Nuvia are expected to be in the established stages of their career development but with a good number of years delivering engineering and licensing solutions.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Key responsibilities of a Nuvia Senior Specialist:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Development of designs to satisfy technical specifications and requirements.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prepare supporting design calculations to substantiation of designs.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Check design calculations of designers and other engineers within the team.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Actively contribute to design &amp; safety reviews (Risk Assessments &amp; HAZOP’s) from technical standpoint.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Preparation of technical specifications in liaison with client and project team.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Produce design documentation throughout the design process including scope of works, method statements, risk assessments, technical files and other technical documentation to comply with design standards, safety legislation\u002Fregulatory requirements and those of the client.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prepare installation, commissioning and operating documents.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Planning &amp; allocation of workload to members of design team in order to deliver packages of work.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Management of sub-contractors providing niche services to the design.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Responsible for managing the quality of the output of their team or their own deliverables.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Responsible for adherence to internal procedures and external codes, standards and directives.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Possible responsible for managing project packages that are sub-contracted to third parties.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Creating designs that are compliant with safety regulations (e.g. CDM and CE marking).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure safety of working environment via design.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Position of the Senior Specialist within the organisation:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Reporting to Container Approvals Manager, Managing Consultant<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Often managing a small team of specialists or design engineers.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Interaction with engineers and specialists of other disciplines, both internal and external.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supervises Nuvia support staff in delivery of work packages.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Ideally you will have the following qualifications, skills, experience and attributes…<\u002Fp>\n <p> Essential:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Delivered nuclear waste package documentation\u002Fdesigns to IAEA SSR-6<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A recognised engineering qualification such as HNC \u002F HND \u002F Degree.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> &gt;5 Years’ experience in the role of design in a nuclear environment, or other equivalent highly regulated industry.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good knowledge of detail design and detailed drawing production within a high tech industry environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to working to tight deadlines &amp; a strong team player attitude.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Proven track record of successfully delivering design solutions.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Concept through to commissioning experience (full lifecycle).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good understanding of Statutory and safety Regulations and their appropriate utilisation.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Proven track record within a project environment with strong organisational and interpersonal skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good customer\u002Fclient liaison skills and good commercial awareness.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrable competence gained in a design delivery position.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge of generic mechanical principle such as forces, stresses, materials selection &amp; design principles.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> For this specific opportunity, the following attributes are desirable:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Assisting the Container Approvals Manager or Nominated engineer to deliver a concept\u002Fdetail design of transport package, and ensuring design intent implemented at manufacturer.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Checking of Concept and Manufacturing drawings.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Production of and checking of structural calculations to recognized codes such as ISO 13001, ASME Boiler &amp; Pressure Vessel Code, BS 2573, Eurocode, PD5500.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Production of and checking of technical documentation including operating, handling and maintenance instructions.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Client interaction through weekly dial ins and regular face to face meetings.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Willing to travel to within the UK and potentially internationally to attend client design meetings and to manufacturer’s site.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Membership of a relevant Institution (e.g. IMechE; IET; IED). Otherwise Nuvia have a program in place to mentor in order to achieve chartership.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Beneficial experience<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Worked within a manufacturing environment, design, testing and commissioning of bespoke equipment within a regulated industry.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Production of Manufacturing drawings.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Witness testing of load and pressure testing, helium leak testing and factory acceptance testing.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Responding to manufacturing TQ’s, concessions and repair procedures.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Quality assurance checking of documentation material certification and quality plans.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge of transport regulations (IAEA SSR-6) production of Package Design Safety Reports.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Appreciation of Shielding design.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Appreciation of Finite Element Analysis.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Appreciation of Criticality assessment.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> Nuvia is a leading international engineering, project management and services provider to the highly regulated nuclear, defence, oil &amp; gas and science &amp; research industries. Our expertise has been developed over many years and is backed up by our highly trained and committed workforce who have a wide range of specialist skills and knowledge. Nuvia is currently recruiting to deliver our live projects and future projects in the nuclear engineering arena.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Benefits: Nuvia offers a competitive pension scheme, health care, Vinci share scheme, cycle to work schemes as well as other benefits.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>NUVIA est une branche de VINCI, plus grand groupe intégré de concessions et BTP du monde. NUVIA est plus particulièrement l'entité nucléaire du Groupe VINCI et est impliqué dans le cycle de vie tout entier des installations nucléaires, du New Build au démantèlement, en passant par la maintenance et l'exploitation. NUVIA est en croissance constante, avec plus de 2700 salariés dans le monde. En moyenne, 100 hommes et femmes nous rejoignent chaque année. Maintenant, plus que jamais, nous recherchons de nouveaux talents pour soutenir la croissance du groupe.<\u002Fp>\n <p>Actemium Automation is part of the VINCI Energies group. Being part of this £12.5 billion organisation allows us to provide our customers with the resources, vitality and strength of a large, global company, while still delivering local, personalised service. You take management, financial and contractual responsibility for your team’s projects and delivery strategy, ensuring proper planning and adequate resourcing, and you ensure that all contractual milestones are met efficiently and cost-effectively. In addition, you are an integral member of Actemium Automation’s management team, contributing to strategic decision-making and planning for the organisation.<\u002Fp>\n <p> You sell concepts, solutions and projects to clients, whilst simultaneously building long-term customer relationships to grow and meet the needs of the team strategy. A proactive team player, you strive to deliver high-quality work and the highest level of customer service.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Main responsibilities:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> Commit to the whole life cycle of delivering projects, from quoting to completion<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be forward thinking to identify any gaps and overloads that may exist in the team’s workload<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Lead a team of engineers, and when needed, contractors, sub-contractors, and work partners, to ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget and to quality requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Identify, manage, and mitigate project risks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Review and negotiate contracts<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Select and manage all sub-contractors required for completion of project<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Identify and manage any work outside of project scope, ensuring customers’ expectations are clearly set out and met<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Attend site for surveys\u002Fclient meetings; <p>Eltek Systems are a leading independent provider of industrial process and automation solutions to the food industry. We are part of Vinci Energies a £12.5 billion organisation and are looking to recruit an experienced Control System Technical Writer to support our ongoing projects in the UK and overseas.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Package: £Competitive Salary + Pension + Share Scheme + Electric Vehicle Car Scheme<\u002Fp>\n <p> This is a niche role. The Technical Writer will play a key role within a team of electrical design engineers, software engineers and technicians to ensure the delivery of complex, quick turn around electrical process and automation projects mainly for the food industry.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Your role will be to produce of a suite of control system technical documentation - on a per project basis - to meet milestone deliverables within time and budget constraints.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The successful candidate will be responsible for producing control system technical documentation (version controlled) such as<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Functional Design Specifications,<\u002Fli>\n  <li> PLC Software Specifications,<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Functional Safety Design Specifications,<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Software Test Record Specifications,<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Factory Acceptance Test Specifications.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> It will involve Frequent progress meetings with project team and liaising with third parties.<\u002Fp>\n <p> A ‘hands on’ approach is essential in this role. A strong technical understanding of production process control and PLC\u002FSCADA software configuration is essential to satisfy this role.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Skills and Experience:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Fully understand the PLC and SCADA software configuration lifecycle against which the technical documentation relates. For Functional Safety Design Documentation Specifications (FSDS) this will involve the application of Safety PLC’s and well as hardwired Safety Systems.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Full understanding of machine automation &amp; applications development; predominantly involving Allen Bradley \u002F Siemens Programmable Logic Controllers, SCADA, related Ethernet based infrastructure and architecture, VFD Drives and Process Instrumentation.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to interpret Piping &amp; Instrumentation Diagrams, Plant Layout Drawings, Motor and Device Listings to capture and document the process control needs of the project.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong verbal and written communication skills are essential<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Proven track record producing technical documentation within the System Integrators environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong technical, control system software development and electrical understanding and experience is essential. Programmable Logic Control (PLC) Software Programming &amp; SCADA configuration is a definite advantage.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Expert of energy technologies and IT services, VINCI Energies (64,500 employees, €10.2 billion of turnover) design, implement and maintain solutions to the industry, service sector and local communities. In the United Kingdom and Republic of Ireland, VINCI Energies provides electrical design, project management, installation and maintenance services since 1907. Through its 16 closely networked Business Units, VINCI Energies operates in 4 different sectors: Infrastructure, Industry, Telecommunications and building services.<\u002Fp>\n <p>Nuvia is expanding its consultancy team and is looking for individuals interested in joining the development of the Systems Engineering capability. This will entail supporting our internal engineering department projects or working alongside our customers with their own contracts and challenges. Candidates can be based at either our Harwell or Warrington office, with hybrid working available.<\u002Fp>\n <p> You would be embedded within the Nuvia Consultancy team reporting to the Systems Engineering manager who will provide support to both personal development and project delivery. We are looking for individuals who are looking for the opportunity to gain responsibility for their own independent delivery and obtain the associated development benefits and advancement working in a consultancy environment.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Occupational Skills and Knowledge:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Working at a principal grade or ability to demonstrate equivalent experience.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Degree qualified in a technical discipline or demonstrable experience.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Working towards, or already obtained chartered status.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> ASEP or CSEP qualified or member of INCOSE is desirable.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Duties and Requirements:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Systems Engineering Specific:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> System Architecture definition.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Interface Management.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Requirement specification production and management.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Requirement compliance and verification management.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Operating requirements management database software.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> System modelling of architecture, interfaces, functions (MBSE)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supporting the training and process development of the systems engineering discipline.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Personal Attributes:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Clear communicator and strong interpersonal skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Motivated and independent.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Positive and resilient.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong organisation and planning skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Logical problem solving \u002F systems thinking approach.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to identify and address improvement opportunities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to work amongst detail whilst balancing overarching project goals and constraints.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> General Technical:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Strong understanding of the fundamentals within own technical discipline.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Previous experience of working within highly regulated industry.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Working with mechanical, electrical, process and civil systems.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support development of designs to satisfy the technical specification.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Contribution to design reviews and safety reviews.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> An understanding of safety requirements and compliance with legislation and regulation.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Level of commercial awareness.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> Nuvia - a subsidiary of VINCI construction - is an international company that operates across highly regulated sectors including Civil Nuclear and has a strong presence and history of delivery at nuclear sites in the UK and internationally.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Nuvia is a performance-driven company that is committed to the development of its people within a culture of safety, innovation, and excellence.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Nuvia UK is committed towards equality in employment.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>NUVIA est une branche de VINCI, plus grand groupe intégré de concessions et BTP du monde. NUVIA est plus particulièrement l'entité nucléaire du Groupe VINCI et est impliqué dans le cycle de vie tout entier des installations nucléaires, du New Build au démantèlement, en passant par la maintenance et l'exploitation. NUVIA est en croissance constante, avec plus de 2700 salariés dans le monde. En moyenne, 100 hommes et femmes nous rejoignent chaque année. Maintenant, plus que jamais, nous recherchons de nouveaux talents pour soutenir la croissance du groupe.<\u002Fp>\n <p>Eltek Systems are a leading independent provider of industrial process and automation solutions to the food industry. We are part of Vinci Energies a £12.5 billion organisation and are looking to recruit an experienced Project Engineer to support our ongoing projects in the UK and overseas.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Package: £Competitive Salary + Pension + Share Scheme + Electric Vehicle Car Scheme<\u002Fp>\n <p> Role Summary:<\u002Fp>\n <p> We are a leading independent provider of industrial process and automation solutions for production lines to the food industry and are looking to recruit an experienced Project Engineer to support our ongoing projects in the UK and overseas.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The project engineer will be working with a team of electrical design engineers, software engineers, and technicians to ensure the completion of complex, quick turn around electrical process and automation projects for the food industry.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Your role will be to ensure delivery of a range of projects including conceptual design to match customer specifications, consultancy, control system integration, installation and commissioning activities within time and budget constraints.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The successful candidate will be responsible for all relevant project documentation such as planning and progress reports as well as holding frequent progress meetings with project team and liaising with third parties.<\u002Fp>\n <p> A ‘hands on’ approach is essential in this role. Strong technical understanding is essential to challenge and drive team performance in all areas.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Occasional Travel overseas will be a requirement<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Skills and Experience:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Able to translate a customer’s User Requirement Specification into a full control system design to an agreed set of deliverables to time and budget. The ability to interpret Piping &amp; Instrumentation Diagrams, Plant Layout Drawings to fully understand meet the process control needs of the client.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Full understanding of machine automation &amp; applications development; predominantly involving Allen Bradley \u002F Siemens Programmable Logic Controllers, SCADA, related Ethernet based infrastructure and architecture, VFD Drives and Process Instrumentation.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Full understanding of best practise and industrial standards for electrical design, safeguarding and machinery regulations. Understanding of CDM Rules and Regulations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong technical, control system and electrical understanding and experience is essential, preferably gained through time served apprenticeship. Programmable Logic Control (PLC) Software Programming experience would be an advantage<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Office based responsibilities:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Formulate competitive tenders and bids, aligned to both contractual obligations, client engineering End User Requirements and Standards.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Delivery of designed engineered solutions (i.e., System Integration) and associated control system deliverables to satisfy the agreed timescales and acceptance criteria for the project, also engineering and generating device lists from P&amp;IDs.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prepare, plan and co-ordinate project engineering activities including budget, schedule and resource allocation.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintain the company business system needs (SAP) for project cost management, milestone invoicing, quality and reporting. Provide project status, technical and\u002For commercial reporting to the Senior Project Manager and stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure compliance with applicable engineering codes, practises, quality standards and Health and Safety at Work Regulations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide associated Risk Assessments &amp; Method Statements for site work activities that are part of the scope of supply.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Site based responsibilities:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Accountable for tasks covering the shipment of equipment to site, electrical installation and control system commissioning activities – both in the UK and globally – that may fall within the scope of the project.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Responsible for the co-ordination of electrical installation activities with client, third party suppliers, OEM’s or other peer contractors involved with the project.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Part of the VINCI Energies Group, Actemium provide engineering design, project management, installation and commissioning of electrical, mechanical and IT services in the United Kingdom since 1907. In addition, we provide specialist maintenance operations, fully complemented with accredited safety tests and inspection services to optimise the operational efficiency and safety of our client's equipment and systems. Whilst part of a global network of 300 Business Units, Actemium UK comprises of 7 Business Units covering all of the UK &amp; RoI.<\u002Fp>\n
