<p>The Company<\u002Fp>\n <p> Actemium Automation Nottingham, (a leading ISO accredited player within the systems integrator sector) are part of the VINCI Energies network of businesses comprising of 20,000 engineers &amp; technicians within 350 local business units across 40 countries worldwide. We support a number of leading blue-chip companies throughout the UK by providing turnkey automation solutions. Our range of services cover essential automation such as control panel design and construction, PLC &amp; SCADA solutions through to leading technology including Manufacturing Operations Management (MoM), information &amp; analytics and Functional Safety consulting services.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The Opportunity<\u002Fp>\n <p> This is a permanent role for a Panelwirer reporting to the Team Leader, responsible for providing the necessary technical expertise and support in relation to assembly of control system activities, whilst meeting agreed production quantity and quality targets in a safe manner. Work to documentation such as method statements, HS&amp;E requirements to ensure safe systems of work. Achieving immediate and short-term objectives, such as output, quality, waste, yield, safety.<\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <br> Required Abilities:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>To interpret GA diagrams for the measuring, marking out, drilling, tapping, component &amp; equipment layout of control panel chassis plates.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Have excellent mechanical knowledge and ability to use various hand &amp; power tools for accurate marking &amp; cutting of enclosures and equipment.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>To assemble in a timely and efficient manner, panels &amp; assemblies from GA’s or Instructions with minimal supervision<\u002Fli>\n   <li>To interpret and understand schematic diagrams and be able to effectively wire control panels and equipment with minimal supervision.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>To be able to fully test &amp; commission control panels with minimal supervision.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>To be able to fault find control panels &amp; equipment with minimal supervision.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>To work as and when required on customer's premises with minimal supervision, following all H&amp;S requirements<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Strong commitment to working as a team<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Use safety equipment and PPE provided<\u002Fli>\n   <li>To exercise reasonable care towards him\u002Fherself and responsibility for the H&amp;S of others<\u002Fli>\n   <li>To comply with safe working practices and procedures at all times<\u002Fli>\n   <li>To co-operate with management and safety representatives to achieve a high standard of safety and housekeeping throughout the workplace and establish a positive QESH culture within the business<\u002Fli>\n   <li>To maintain good timekeeping<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <br> Working Environment\n  <br> As normal for a manufacturing environment, work involves frequent lifting of materials. Machinery operation requires the use of safety equipment to include but not limited to; eye safety glasses, hearing protectors, work boots, and hardhats. Loose fitting clothes and jewellery are not permitted\n  <br> \n  <br> Competitive Salary and Benefits will include:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>37½ hours working week<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Flexi-Time (with core hours)<\u002Fli>\n   <li>25 days annual leave + 8 bank holidays<\u002Fli>\n   <li>5% matched pension<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Access to a Health Cash Plan<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Cycle to work scheme<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Death In Service<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Car Benefit Scheme<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Company Workwear and PPE provided <\u002Fli>\n   <li>Opportunity to purchase shares in Vinci SA (subject to the scheme running)<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> The Requirements\n  <br> Qualifications\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Apprentice trained desirable and\u002For 5+ years of providing significant hands on experience.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Safety awareness to work to documentation such as method statements and risk assessments.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> Technical Skill and Experience\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Basic reading, writing, and arithmetic skills required.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Manual dexterity required for wiring, drilling, fixing down<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Ability to read and interpret electrical drawings<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Good communication and interpersonal skills with willingness to take on new skills &amp; knowledge.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Good aptitude to learn from and influence others with the ability to communicate effectively at all levels is essential.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Maintain a professional appearance and approach to colleagues and customers.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Part of the VINCI Energies Group, AND Automation provides solutions foe industry including the design and integration of industrial automation, supervosry control and data acquisition (SCADA)_ and reporting systems &amp; controls together with implementation and commissioning services. Its main market sectors include Food &amp; Beverage, Pharmaceutical, Chemical and Energy from Waste.<\u002Fp>\n <p>Nuvia are currently recruiting for an experienced Electrical Engineer to work on a permanent basis, supporting on the Hinkley Point C project. Electrical Contracts Technical lead activities (except qualification activities) in the scope of Edvance UK for UK EPR. Particularly but not exclusively on electrical penetration contract.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Input data:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Reference documents (ENG, DP, CST, process, etc.)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Technical specifications of contracts.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Terms of reference.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Interface Data sheets, existing modifications, open points.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Main Activities:<br> Electrical Contract Technical lead activities:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Entry point for the client organization concerning all technical topics linked to the contract and to produce support to the Client organization for technical issue (proactivity during the resolution part)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure the technical management of the supplier, and support the Client in its contractual relationship with the supplier during the contract execution phase (in particular with regard to compliance with the schedule, costs, and scope of supply and studies).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Review of supplier documents according to technical referential in time, respecting the contractual deadlines, with good level of quality and coordinate the documentary review of the various contributors.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Produce comment sheets via dedicated tool to the supplier and perform discussion with supplier if needed.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Manage modifications on the contracts; to inform supplier via CTS send to the Client via dedicated tools.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Entry point for all modifications, technical issues or non-conformities coming from site activities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure the management of risks, opportunities, open points and modifications of its contract with the Client.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Writing the surveillance plan and reports.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Follow-up of the activity of manufacturing for HPC Unit 2 in interface with other stakeholders.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Manage the interfaces with all disciplines implicated in the contract (cabling, connecting, piping, layout, I&amp;C, etc.); and especially with the qualification part performed in EDVANCE France.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support the pacification of activities and to follow all the Delivery To Site dates for equipment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Contribute to topics around good practises, innovation, improvement of processes, and quality.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Participate in experience sharing activities.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Activities listed above, are managed through different meetings:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Weekly technical meeting to discuss about technical issues.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Manufacturing meeting to follow the Delivery To Site for equipment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Monthly meeting to have an overview concerning all parts (technical, planning, review, risks, …) for the contract.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Meeting with site to be informed of technical issue.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Required technical skills<\u002Fp>\n <p> Essential:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Electrical engineering degree.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Minimum 5 years in specification, design, procurement and installation of electrical <br> components.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge of RCC-E code.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge of 2D and 3D design software.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience working in a multicultural environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge of the HPC project or previous EPR and associated studies\u002Fdoctrine is a real asset.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Skills required:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Experience in the management of transverse technical and contractual topics.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent Interpersonal skills, conscientiousness, organisation, writing ability.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good organizational, writing and oral expression skills in English are essential for the realization of the activities of document production, steering and interfaces with the various correspondents.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to prioritise, to manage numerous interfaces, to question and understand the imperatives of other downstream disciplines. Ability to meet commitments and deadlines.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Languages (level):<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> English fluent.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> French is a bonus.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> Nuvia - a subsidiary of VINCI construction - is an international company that operates across highly regulated sectors including Civil Nuclear and has a strong presence and history of delivery at nuclear sites in the UK and internationally. Nuvia is a performance-driven company that is committed to the development of its people within a culture of safety, innovation, and excellence.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>NUVIA est une branche de VINCI, plus grand groupe intégré de concessions et BTP du monde. NUVIA est plus particulièrement l'entité nucléaire du Groupe VINCI et est impliqué dans le cycle de vie tout entier des installations nucléaires, du New Build au démantèlement, en passant par la maintenance et l'exploitation. NUVIA est en croissance constante, avec plus de 2700 salariés dans le monde. En moyenne, 100 hommes et femmes nous rejoignent chaque année. <p>Actemium Automation Nottingham, (a leading ISO accredited player within the systems integrator sector) are part of the VINCI Energies network of businesses comprising of 20,000 engineers &amp; technicians within 350 local business units across 40 countries worldwide. We support a number of leading blue-chip companies throughout the UK by providing turnkey automation solutions. Our range of services cover essential automation such as control panel design and construction, PLC &amp; SCADA solutions through to leading technology including Manufacturing Operations Management (MoM), information &amp; analytics and Functional Safety consulting services.<\u002Fp>\n <p> We are looking to recruit a Project Manager to help run one of our most important customers.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Package: (Competitive Salary + Car Allowance + Bonus + Healthcare + Share Scheme + Pension + Benefits)<\u002Fp>\n <p> Business Development, sales, Project Management of control systems projects in accordance with company, customer and legislative requirements. Leadership of the team based at the Towcester office.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Task Competencies<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Preparation of detailed technical customer quotations for bespoke Control Systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong Negotiation skills when pricing work, rework or variations<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Liaise directly with customers (throughout all stages of a project \u002F programme)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A strong technical solution sales approach.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work alongside other Programme Mangers to develop existing client relationships and identify future requirements on site(s).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to communicate effectively with different audiences both verbally and in writing combined with strong presentation skills with both technical and commercial content<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Direct liaison with customers and internal design\u002Fmanagement team<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Review of the design and testing of control systems in accordance with agreed specifications, applicable standards and legislative requirements.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide technical supervision of system design, build and installation personnel.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Carry out tendering activity with cost estimation, technical proposals &amp; presentation.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure that all-relevant Health and Safety Procedures are adhered to.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong team leadership skills.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> Ideally qualified to HNC \u002F HND \u002F Degree level in a relevant discipline and several years’ experience in system integration OR many years’ experience in systems integration with lower qualifications.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> High level of ability to understand and produce control system design documents.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong understanding of technical project life cycle.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good to High Level of Software Experience with:<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> E C &amp; I System for in process and manufacturing environments<\u002Fli>\n  <li> PLC based control system architecture<\u002Fli>\n  <li> PLC, HMI &amp; SCADA coding<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Integrated system testing of application software and the industrial hardware<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Machinery Safety design and associated standards<\u002Fli>\n  <li> On site commissioning of industrial control systems<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Working knowledge of industrial hardware systems:<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Control panel design and assembly<\u002Fli>\n  <li> C &amp; <p>Actemium Automation is a control and automation systems integrator. We operate from 11 offices in England and employ 250 people. We are part of VINCI Energies; a £12.5 billion organisation and we are looking to recruit a Senior Software Controls Systems Engineer to join our expanding team in Huddersfield. The role will see you tasked with Project delivery mostly within Process industries. The ideal candidate will have experience of working for on Project delivery for a Systems Integrator.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Competitive Salary + Share Scheme + Profit Share Scheme + Electric Vehicle Car Scheme + Pension + Healthcare + 25 days holiday<\u002Fp>\n <p> The Role<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Actively participates in the whole life cycle of delivering projects, from start to finish.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Foster great relationships with customers, suppliers and colleagues.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Produce design and test documentation.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Develop PLC, HMI and some SCADA software.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Perform testing with customers.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Carry out on-site commissioning.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Compile training manuals and run customer training sessions.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> Intermediate-level experience with Mitsubishi and other major brands of PLC HMI platforms, with an appetite to learn new technologies.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Several years' experience writing software and working with customers delivery projects.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good understanding of setting up, commissioning, and fault finding of industrial networks (Profibus, ProfiNet, Ethernet) preferred, but not essential.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience working in an engineering environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Thinks outside the box and pushes the boundaries.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Highly motivated, organised and flexible.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Positive, personable and happy team player.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to work unsupervised.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good working knowledge of Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel and Outlook.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must be eligible to work in the UK.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>Part of the VINCI Energies Group, Actemium provide engineering design, project management, installation and commissioning of electrical, mechanical and IT services in the United Kingdom since 1907. In addition, we provide specialist maintenance operations, fully complemented with accredited safety tests and inspection services to optimise the operational efficiency and safety of our client's equipment and systems. Whilst part of a global network of 300 Business Units, Actemium UK comprises of 7 Business Units covering all of the UK &amp; RoI.<\u002Fp>\n <p>Working for the CS&amp;A Responsible Engineer, the CS&amp;A Lead Engineer is required to support the delivery of the CS&amp;A elements of the project, in collaboration with other stakeholders and engineering disciplines. The role will involve the following, among others:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Lead the design delivery of the CS&amp;A elements of the project, collaborating with the other engineering disciplines to meet project objectives and milestones.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Lead optioneering of the proposed new cable routes, to determine the preferred solution based on underpinning assessments.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to communicate well at all levels, not just Technical.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Developing, allocating and supervising delivery of CS&amp;A design deliverables (e.g. designs, assessments, drawings, and reports), checking and ensuring the appropriate quality is delivered.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supporting assistance and assurance reviews at important junctures of the design development to ensure that the output meets the project objectives; and<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Monitoring and reporting progress against delivery schedules to AEM and PM.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Structural site surveys, to assess the condition of cable supports and trenches and to record the findings.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> General all round civil and structural design experience required, with experience working on new nuclear build and interfaces with existing structures.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience is also required in the design of concrete, steel and masonry structures, subject to normal and abnormal environmental loading.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supporting the production of estimates and schedules for required design phases.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experienced in delivering work for SL (preferred).<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Location is ideally Warrington but can be West Cumbria with ability to travel between sites.<\u002Fp>\n <p> This role requires interface with Integrated Design Team, facility team (including systems engineering), other project functions and must work closely throughout project phases. The ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and on-site (Sellafield) visits. It will be necessary to attend meetings and to undertake site visits to Sellafield.<\u002Fp>\n <p> In support of the Infrastructure Gated Programme\u002FPortfolio, PZPSP will address the strategic need to supply power to SRP and for other planned facilities in the Product Zone by constructing Substation 78 to the south of B594 and providing all the interconnecting cables.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The aim of this project is to address two main issues:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Deliver an enterprise power infrastructure to enable the Product Zone Area to be provided with adequate power supply capacity.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> To use such enterprise power infrastructure to supply the first plant in the Product Zone: SRP.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> The CS&amp;A elements of the project will include (but not limited to):<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Site surveys of the existing cable supports and trenches: assessing their condition and proposing remedial works were applicable.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Optioneering the proposed new cable routes, to determine the preferred solution based on underpinning assessments.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Input into the specifications for the surveys for risk reduction PCI design works.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> CS&amp;A led stakeholder engagement.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> Essential Qualifications:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Degree qualified CS&amp;A Engineer (or equivalent through enhanced experience).<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Essential Experience:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> A minimum of three years working at Sellafield, nuclear or within a highly regulated industry.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Structural site surveys, able to assess the condition of steel and concrete structural elements (cable supports and trenches).<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Familiar with a range of available design technologies and techniques.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Production of CS&amp;A design documents e.g. civil and structural calculations (design\u002Fassessment\u002Fsubstantiation), engineering drawings, specifications, scopes of work, method statements.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Proficient in Steel and Concrete design to current codes.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Continual ongoing assurance of the application of CDM and the recording of such.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Capable of independent and autonomous work during the delivery of packages.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to actively seek input from other engineers, specialists, facility and project team members to improve understanding and deliver fit for purpose solutions.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be able to present information in forms specifically aimed at a variety of target audiences.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Capable of achieving the Sellafield Baseline Personnel Security Standard as a minimum. Preference is for the candidate to have an existing P1\u002FP4 pass.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Proficient in analysis\u002Fdesign packages ie. STAAD.Pro for Steel and Concrete analysis\u002Fdesign.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good proficiency in Microsoft packages (Excel, Word, Visio, Power point, Outlook, etc) and use of Navisworks Freedom.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good working knowledge of other IT systems (AutoCAD \u002F DM Desktop) will be invaluable but not essential<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> Nuvia is a leading international engineering, project management and services provider to the highly regulated nuclear, defence, oil &amp; gas, and science &amp; research industries. Our expertise has been developed over many years and is backed up by a highly trained, committed workforce and a wide range of specialist resources.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>NUVIA est une branche de VINCI, plus grand groupe intégré de concessions et BTP du monde. NUVIA est plus particulièrement l'entité nucléaire du Groupe VINCI et est impliqué dans le cycle de vie tout entier des installations nucléaires, du New Build au démantèlement, en passant par la maintenance et l'exploitation. NUVIA est en croissance constante, avec plus de 2700 salariés dans le monde. En moyenne, 100 hommes et femmes nous rejoignent chaque année. Maintenant, plus que jamais, nous recherchons de nouveaux talents pour soutenir la croissance du groupe.<\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  NUVIA have a new vacancy for a Senior Mechanical Specialist on a contract basis who specialise grow in the field of Nuclear Waste Packages (Type B \u002F IP). We are growing capability across our locations and a number of roles are available dependent on experience.\n  <br> \n  <br> Senior Mechanical Specialist: Role Overview\n  <br> \n  <br> As a Senior Mechanical Specialist specialising in Engineering (nuclear waste packages) &amp; Licensing you will join our burgeoning team which you will build experience and design techniques and appreciate the whole life-cycle of engineering consultancy projects. Most of this is achieved by day-to-day guidance in live projects, some big and some small. This will include initial concept design through optioneering, detailed design, substantiation of designs, license applications to regulators, manufacturing of the waste packages across the UK, and supporting operational fleets. \n  <br> \n  <br> The successful applicant may be a good graduate or apprentice who has completed a scheme, and is now looking for a new challenge, or a slightly more experienced specialist that is keen to stay in a engineering generating position. \n  <br> \n  <br> As well as receiving first-class training and support in design and licensing activities such as the implications of structural, impact, thermal, shielding and criticality assessments, you’ll work alongside and learn from some of the most respected and highly qualified professionals in their field. Your training will be organised to provide you with the skills and experience to apply for membership of the IMechE and become a professional accredited engineer.\n  <br> \n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>You will be an active team member in a supportive work environment, contributing to the achievement of real business objectives and assigned to live projects - some of which are the largest and most exciting projects taking place within the nuclear industry. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>As part of the team you will gain the experience required to grow in responsibility for delivering and planning engineering tasks of increasing size \u002Fas your career progresses. The area of Engineering and Licensing (in particular, Licensing Assessment\u002FApplications and Hand Calculations) is treated as a part of the formal design process and is also vital for achieving regulatory acceptance for our customers. <\u002Fli>\n   <li>You will interface with other engineering disciplines; project managers, production engineers, inspectors, nuclear safety and engineering analysis specialists.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>The portfolio of projects has many waste packages in manufacturing phase or recently manufactured, so you get to see your hard work come to life!<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><br> Skills &amp; Qualifications<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Technical abilities are essential, so you will need a Masters or bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field. We look for those with a passion for engineering and problem solving and would have an interest in designs, materials, manufacturing, how to operate &amp; maintain mechanical components, and the essentials of how radiation shielding works in practice. It would benefit if you covered &amp; enjoyed degree modules such as mechanics of structures and dynamics, preferably including CAD.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Just as important are your behaviours; we are looking out for candidates with great communication skills, who are proactive, focused, and have the ability to work on their own and as part of a team.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?\n <p><br> All about us:<\u002Fp>\n <p> Nuvia is a leading international consultancy, engineering, project management and services provider to the highly regulated nuclear, defence, and science &amp; research industries. Our expertise has been developed over many years and is backed up by our highly trained and committed workforce who have a wide range of specialist skills and knowledge. Nuvia is currently recruiting to deliver our live projects and future projects in the nuclear legacy, existing nuclear operations &amp; decommissioning arena<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <p>Entité<\u002Fp> \n  <p>NUVIA est une branche de VINCI, plus grand groupe intégré de concessions et BTP du monde. NUVIA est plus particulièrement l'entité nucléaire du Groupe VINCI et est impliqué dans le cycle de vie tout entier des installations nucléaires, du New Build au démantèlement, en passant par la maintenance et l'exploitation. NUVIA est en croissance constante, avec plus de 2700 salariés dans le monde. En moyenne, 100 hommes et femmes nous rejoignent chaque année. Maintenant, plus que jamais, nous recherchons de nouveaux talents pour soutenir la croissance du groupe.<\u002Fp>\n <p>Nuvia is expanding its consultancy team and is looking for individuals interested in joining the development of the Systems Engineering capability. This will entail supporting our internal engineering department projects or working alongside our customers with their own contracts and challenges. Candidates can be based at either our Harwell or Warrington office, with hybrid working available.<\u002Fp>\n <p> You would be embedded within the Nuvia Consultancy team reporting to the Systems Engineering manager who will provide support to both personal development and project delivery. We are looking for individuals who are looking for the opportunity to gain responsibility for their own independent delivery and obtain the associated development benefits and advancement working in a consultancy environment.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Occupational Skills and Knowledge:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Working at a senior grade or ability to demonstrate equivalent experience.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> requirements management database software.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> System modelling of architecture, interfaces, functions (MBSE)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supporting the training and process development of the systems engineering discipline.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Personal Attributes:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Clear communicator and strong interpersonal skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Motivated and NUVIA est en croissance constante, avec plus de 2700 salariés dans le monde. En moyenne, 100 hommes et femmes nous rejoignent chaque année.
